column1: Nice features, but poor low RF signal reception
column2: I just purchased the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 from a local Verizon store. I am very disappointed with this phone. I paid full price to keep my unlimited data alive. I am finding that the RF reception is abysmal. In buildings where I used to get -89 dbm with my Motorola Droid Bionic, I get -118 dbm with the Samsung Galaxy Note 3. Even outdoors, with the Samsung Galaxy Note 3, I don't get that great of a 4G LTE signal. The phone will usually then switch to 1 to 2 bars of 3G and stay there until I am back in a really strong 4G area. I'm thinking either the antenna is of poor quality or the radio is not very sensitive - or both. I may have to return this phone and try the LG G2. This GN3 cannot even begin to compete with my old Motorola Droid Bionic when it comes to holding on to a less than perfect signal.In strong signal areas there is no problem, but when the signal isn't the best, the GN3 does a poor job of holding the 4G LTE signal.My Motorola Droid Bionic used to do an outstanding job in the same exact places this GN3 fails.The screen is brilliant, and you couldn't ask for a more feature packed phone.The sound quality is good and volume level is great, but above all the GN3 has to be able to connect to a signal to be a great phone.In the near future, Verizon is going to Voice over LTE (VoLTE).This means that our phone conversations will now be carried on the 4G LTE band.That really scares me with my GN3, since it can't maintain a 4G LTE signal unless I'm really in a strong signal area.

column1: Love the phone, hate the policy
column2: I have the original unlocked international version of the Galaxy Note N7000 and I absolutely love it and I was about to purchase a Note 3 until I read the reviews.When I pay 500-800 dollars for an unlocked phone, I should be able to add or remove apps and activate it anywhere.Even my current phone has apps that I can't remove unless I root the phone.I'm certain that the Galaxy Note 3 is a phenomenal phone, it's Samsung's policy, akin to retaining partial ownership, that I find offensive. Until that changes I won't buy a Samsung product. Samsung's motive is erecting an obstacle to the gray market. As far as I'm concerned the gray market is also the free-market. Governments and companies love to tout the free market but won't hesitate to manipulate/interfere with it. Don't expect me to be complicit.I'm not sure what the gray market direction is but if it's from the US to other countries I suggest sellers look into purchasing cheap sim cards from straight talk for the initial activation.I'm not sure if it will work but anything to contribute to the failure of Samsung's idiotic business decision.

I've had the note 3 and previously the 2 and with both I had bad signal and it would constantly overheat. Sometimes the phone would be idle and still overheat, I replaced it twice and same issue. This phone has a lot of bells and whistles but lacks reliability.

I was excited to purchase this device since before it came out.I did a lot of research and waited quite a few months before upgrading from my Galaxy S3. Initially I was satisfied with the device.10 days after purchasing the device; however, I am stuck paying more money to replace it. Normally I do not purchase insurance on devices and luckily the phone company put it on without asking me. I did not drop or put any excessive pressure on the phone to damage it. I set the device on the counter and when I picked it up a few minutes later the screen was malfunctioning. Having 14 days to take it back to the provider I tried that first. I was informed that there was a pressure crack in the LCD and that apparently I had caused it. Knowing that I had not done anything to cause it I became very upset. I was told that I could send it to the provider but if they determined that the phone was damaged I would have to pay full retail for the replacement refurbished device they replaced mine with. The other option was paying the $100 deductible for my insurance and not knowing exactly what was wrong with the device. I turned to Samsung to solve this delima. They looked at the phone and determined the LCD was cracked, said that I caused the damage to the device and it would cost over $200 to repair. Now I have a device that I did not damage and must pay an insurance deductible on to replace. I asked how to file a complaint with Samsung about this and they said I cannot. After further researching this specific issue I have found that this is actually a common issue with this device. It can actually occur due to temperature changes in the device that are considered normal operating temperatures. I have to note that I loved my Galaxy S3. It was why I stayed with a Samsung device. I was even considering buying a Samsung television because I love my old phone so much. The S3 was durable as hell. I musthave dropped it 100 times before the front glass cracked, the LCD still works flawlessly. Apparently the quality of their products are not uniform across the company and they don't stand behind their products even when they should be under warranty.I will NEVER purchase another product from them again. Be cautious when making a purchase from them.

I have had this smartphone for a few months now and I continue to be disappointed with how buggy and unreliable it is.I constantly have problems getting the phone and headset features work consistently.Also, the phone is a power hog, even with the large battery.I have constantly having to turn off features like WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS, etc. when not using them or I have no chance of getting through the day on one charge.When the battery does get low -- below 5% -- the phone has to be powered off to charge or it will shut itself down, even if it is connected to a charger.One of the most irritating features is that you have to enter your password to turn the phone ringer on or off.I do like the large screen but that is about the ONLY thing I like about this device.I will be moving back to an iPhone when they release their larger screens later this year.

So, I got this phone using "Verizon Edge" program - ordered over the phone. When I received it, it wouldn't activate. The SIM card number wasn't on the order. I had to pry the SIM card out of the Note 3, which is NOT an easy thing to do! I had to do this to read the SIM card number to Verizon Wireless, so they could activate it.I noticed that when I had device on maximum brightness (NOT on "Automatic") and was working on something over extended amount of time, the brightness would dim for a few seconds, then return to max. This would keep happening, at random intervals, and to seemingly random brightness levels. If I continued still to use it... say after 45 minutes or something, it would dim to MINIMUM brightness for few seconds.Now, it wouldn't show me or tell me in any way what brightness level it was changing to... I could just tell when it was putting to MINIMUM brightness. I got it replaced for another Note 3... The replacement had same issue... I called Verizon Wireless and then they revealed to me that this was a feature built into device by the manufacturer. I even spoke to Samsung to verify this.So, stay away from the Galaxy Note 3 at ALL COSTS! ANYONE that owned this device might need to operate the device on maximum brightness for extended amount of time... I mean, why have a long life battery, quad core cpu, and 3 gb RAM, if you can't fully utilize them? So, this phone does this to prevent overheating. Why would a $700 phone have a problem with overheating!?!STAY AWAY FROM THE GALAXY NOTE 3!

When I start my car with the Note 3 bluetooth on, Samsung feels compelled, via the smartphone, to say something like "Good morning. I hope you have a nice day". Actually, I'm not interested in Samsung being part of the family like that. I just want a smart phone. Ironically, their message degrades what was starting as a nice day. Maybe I've turned the radio on. Suddenly there are two sound sources. It's distracting, and while driving!Maybe this can be turned off. I think I found a way once, but then it reverted. I don't want to spend a lot of time learning how to deal with this.Samsung does the same with their washers and dryers. Basically good machines, they will wait until you're unloading clothes, with ear next to the machine, then hit you with a jingle. Why?It's too bad, because the Note 3 is generally a great smart phone, but with the Samsung's fixation on popping people with the sound intrusion, I can't rate it better than 1 star.

I made the move from an iPhone to the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 about 4 months ago. Since then, it's brought me nothing but trouble. I have to restart the phone on a daily basis just to make calls, the phone constantly overheats, and doesn't hold a charge for longer than 6hrs on standby.I've never downloaded games or any other questionable apps. The phone is just crap compared to the iPhone.

column1: Can't get past the eligibility for upgrade form...
column2: Ive used three different computers, three different browsers (on recommendation from Amazon support) and can't get past the screen that checks your eligibility for upgrade to a new device. I have had my current contract with Verizon for two and a half years, I was eligible for upgrade in August. Sucks that I now have to pay $299.99 to Verizon for the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 which is offered here for a $179.99 upgrade. Major fail Amazon, and I was thinking about coming to work for you in Dupont. Fat chance with this debacle and your questionable corporate policies. Not liking the tease.

Phone is great, love it.When my company cancelled my work phone I was happy to pick this up.But trying to transfer my number was a disaster.Verizon figured out how to do it and credit things correctly, but Amazon is lost.Wants to charge me the full cost of the phone even though Verizon said everything was ok.Just want to keep my same number.If I have to I will be sending the phone back and never trying to do this type of thing with Amazon ever.Sometimes you just need a human.

I bought the galaxy note 3 out of contract because I travel a lot between Europe and the USA and I need to switch between sim cards often. However, the so-called "unlocked" version of the note 3 is actually region-locked, so that if you buy it in Europe it will not accept *any* sim from the USA (and vice-versa). And of course, I had no idea of that limitation, nor did my seller...Afterwards I found on the Internet people saying that Samsung could unlock my device if I complained hard enough; that I did, but they did not; I am now stuck with a half-useless phone. Thanks but no thanks, Samsung!Too bad: the note 3 (when in its locked-region) is actually a great phone...

THIS IS MY 5 NEW PHONE REPLACEMENT IN 3 WEEKS.. IT NOT EASY TO TURN THE PHONE ON WHEN THE PHONE RING OR TURN IT ON..IT RESPOND VERY SLOW OR NO RESPOND AT ALL. I HAVE TO CONSTANTLY REMOVE BATTERY AND REBOOT THE PHONE.IT TAKES TOO LONG TO DIAL A PHONE NUMBER. WHEN YOU TAKE PICTURE, IT TAKES TOO LONG TO GET A CLEAR PICTURE. AN AVERAGE OF 5 SECONDS OR LONGER.IF I WANT TO DELETE PICTURES, SOME I CAN AND SOME I CANNOT. SOMETIME THE PICTURES MOVE AROUND TO DIFFERENT CATEGORY BY ITSELF WHEN I TRY TO SEE MY PICTURES.IF I TOUCH A SCREEN. IT MOVE LEFT OR RIGHT. IT STILL HAVE PROBLEMS AFTER I GOT ANOTHER NEW PHONE REPLACEMENT.

AFTER GOING THROUGH 13 REPLACEMENT GALAXY NOTE 3IN 4 MONTHS, I DECIDED TO GIVE UP AND AND TRY HTC ONE MAX TO SEE IF IT BETTER THAN NOTE 3.THE NOTE 3 GIVE ME SO MUCH STRESS. IT THE SAME PROBLEM OVER AND OVER,OVER. I HAVE TO REMOVE BATTERY ONCE A WEEK WHEN IT FREEZE, UNABLE TO ANSWER PHONE, NEED TO TAKE SEVERAL SHOT TO GET A CLEAR PICTURE, AND IT REBOOT BY ITSELF. ANOTHER PROBLEM IS IT NOT LOUD ENOUGH TO HEAR WHEN I AM IN A CROWD OR RESTAURANTS. THE MUSIC SPEAKER WAS AWFUL.

I traded in my iPhone 5 because I thought this phone looked great in-store. I previously owned phones --way back-- like the Omnia,and was hesitant about the Samsungs again. The size of the phone is about the only redeeming value. It's a big screen, yes. But, other than that the rest is downhill.Call Quality: Horrble! I never had an issue with my other iPhones, or phones. This sounds like I'm calling from a bathtub. That is, when it's not dropping my calls (on Verizon, too!) Try it on speakerphone? Ha! Good luck. Call quality takes another enormous dive.Responsiveness: It lags a lot for me, applications are often slow.Graphics and Pictures: Pictures are pretty decent. Not bad.I get a lot of black screens and have to restart applications. When I go from say a Twitter link to something else, it's black, slow to load. I thought the phone would be blazing fast, but it's way below any iPhone or even other phones. My wife has the LG G2, and while it's supposed to be fast (LG G2) it makes the Galaxy Note III look abysmally slow.Overall, I'm greatly disappointed in this phone. I switched because I think it had great promise as an "all-in-one" type phone, but not for me. I'm going to trade the phone back in for something else and likely take an incredibly big financial hit for buying this piece of garbage.

Two of my family members received these phones several weeks ago. There are persistent andserious problems with call quality that have never been resolved. Many calls to tech support and updates did not resolve the problem.
I don't understated why on the main search page, it says item is $199.99, but when you click in the item, there are no options for that price. It's $709. Hmm....

column1: "My Magazine" is baked in the HOME KEY. YOU CANNOT REMOVE IT
column2: REALLY SAMSUNG? You integrate the most used key (center home button) on your phone and add "My Magazine" function to it. If you press the home key twice you are AUTOMATICALLY greeted to the "My Magazine"feature and then YOU MUST register and "AGREE" to the terms BEFORE you can "disable it". I BOUGHT YOUR PHONE FOR THE EXCELLENT HARDWARE NOT YOUR HALF BAKED SOFTWARE. BY FORCING ME TO "agree" the terms in order to "disable" it, you've achieved the exactly opposite. This is EXTREMELY INFURIATING and OFF-PUTTING. VIRTUALLY 90% OF REVIEW SITES MOCK YOUR BLOATWARE AND YOU INSIST THAT THE CONSUMERS WILL LIKE IT. YOU'RE NOT GOOGLE AND NEVER WILL BE. STICK WITH THE HARDWARE - SOMETHING YOU'RE SUPERB AT IT AND LEAVE THE BLOATWARE FOR YOUR EMPLOYEES. THIS ONE IS GOING TO BE RETURNED IMMEDIATELY DUE TO YOUR INABILITY TOLEARN FROM YOUR MISTAKE. THOSE WHO FAILED TO LEARN FROM HISTORY ARE DOOMED TO FAIL SO THEY SAY. STOP FORCING PEOPLE USING YOUR CRAPWARE SERIOUSLY. I WAS REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO USING MY NOTE 3 BUT THISGARBAGE "MY MAGAZINE" SINGLEHANDEDLY TURNED ME OFF TO THE POINT OF SWITCHING TO ANOTHER DEVICE. GOOD JOB, SAMSUNG!

column1: Very happy with this Phone - Scratch That...BUYER BEWARE
column2: I bought this phone as a replacement to my son's Galaxy, which fell out of his pocket and got run over. A friend at Church recommend BLU. After playing with their phone for a bit I decided to make the purchase as a Christmas present. I like the feel and weight of the phone. The search bar is a bit annoying but my son doesn't mind. The launcher can be replaced with something off of Google Play. The screen color levels are even, crisp, and clear.I like that it is a dual sim because I will be purchasing one of the more expensive, higher performing BLUs for myself. The Dual SIM will allow me to use my personal and work service on the same phone. This leaves me open to not having to return my phone if I ever decide to leave my job. It also helps since I travel internationally. I can pick up a short term daily/weekly local card to make local calls and not be charged international rates.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is case selection. I found some generic cases online, but the one I ordered isn't an exact fit. Would be awesome if Lifeproof or Otterbox would make a case for these phones. One bonus that I wasn't expecting though. The phone comes with a rubber slip on case.UPDATE: BUYER BEWAREIt's been 10 months and the phone will freeze and periodically shutdown on its own. Did a factory reset and reconfigured, still same issue. I contacted the seller and was told that they only honor return after 30 days even if it's a defect. So, now I have to engage BLU directly. They want me to pay shipping both ways. Yes, shipping to get their defective product to them and then shipping back if they send a replacement or fix it. If the phone gets there and they determine there is no issue, then they'll charge me a bench fee. I am so unhappy at this point.

column1: Great phone and a great deal!
column2: I am actually really pleased with this phone as my husband and I came from an Iphone and Samsung galaxy s3. We have MetroPCS so my husband bought his phone at the MetroPCS store (it was $200!) and I got mine here (cheapest around). This really came unlocked so you can use with any carrier. Ive had it for 5 days and no issues like other people have been having. It is a little confusing trying to figure out which slot the sim cards goes in since it's a dual slot but your cell carrier will do it for you. it's a little difficult to put in since you need not just the sim card but needs a little holder too so the sim is smaller than the slot in the back of the phone. This runs Android's software so anyone familiar (or not) will not have an issue with learning the software. Camera takes great pics, I can take screen shots, transfer data via bluetooth, wifi is great, and it has the google play store so you dont have to worry about not being able to access apps. It doesnt have LTE BUT it's vesion of LTE is the H+ which actually worked faster than my Galaxy s3. The phone calls are crystal clear, speakerphone is powerful, but the earbuds dont work that well. Walgreens sells basic earbuds with the microphone so not a big deal. This used the same charger as my Galaxy s3! It's weird that the charger is at the top of the phone but eh that doesnt really make a big difference to me. I am used to having an actual button to get to the home screen so since this phone everything is touch it took me a few hours to get used to it. I have only come across one drawback, which is the internal memory, which is 2GB, and with just a few apps and its cached data gets sucked up quickly so I highly recommend getting a memory chip. This phone doesnt have the best selection of cases or screen protectors but if you go online via Amazon or newgg.com, you can find a relatively cheap one. The phone has a large 5in screen and is very bright in display so it's very easy on the eyes. I always had to dim my Galaxy's brightness to conserve battery but this Blu phone lasts almost all day with using apps like Facebook and OfferUp and texting and still holds a charge! I really recommend this phone as well as the seller because I got my item as described AND super fast shipping!! I even got this on a Sunday!

column1: Good starter phone, Impressive, but it has it's flaws.
column2: The BLU Studio 5.0 II is an unlocked GSM phone that works with AT&T and T-mobile in the US, as well as many wireless carriers overseas.It allows the user to install two SIMs in the phone at the same time, which lets you make and receive calls from two numbers on a single phone,for home and work for example.The phone uses standard/mini SIM cards, so if you have a micro SIM, you'll need an adapter.The BLU studio 5.0 II has a stock install of Android 4.2 (Jelly bean).The microSD slot accepts cards up to 32GB.I do have an issue with the metal clip that holds the SD card in place.It seems that the clip only holds the SD card in place as long as the battery cover is on.It's easy to lose the SD card if you remove the battery cover to swap out a SIM card.In fact, I lost an 8GB card while changing SIMs.The phone has GPS, a compass, and gyroscope.The GPS updates fairly slowly, and the compass and gyroscope hardly update at all using a diagnostic program like GPS Test plus.The GPS is good enough for turn-by-turn directions in Google Maps.While using the phone for simple things like surfing the web and reading emails is smooth and responsive, The BLU Studio has significant performance issues when using graphics intensive programs.I suspectthis is due to BLU cutting too many corners to keep the cost low.The most significant cost-cutting measure was the decision to include only 512MB of RAM which, in my opinion, really isn't enough for a modern version of Android like Jelly bean.The phone comes with 4GB of ROM, of which 1.2 GB is available for the storage of apps, music, photos, etc.In addition to the usual USB cable and charging block, the BLU Studio also comes with a pair of ear buds with microphone, and a clear-ish silicon case that fits well and provides adequate protection for the phone.The case doesn't fit as snugly as I'd like, but it does not slip off easily.Call quality is good, and I can hear callers loud and clear.However, the callers have told me that my voice is not of the best quality while using the phone's built-in microphone.I don't believe this is a problem with the microphone itself, asthe quality I get from the voice recorder is good.This doesn't appear to be a problem if I use a bluetooth headset.The 5-inch screen is reasonably bright and clear as long as I'm looking as the screen head-on, but the brightness and clarity drops off rapidly when viewed at an angle.Overall, the BLU studio 5.0 II is a good phone for the price.It would make a good starter smart phone.Just don't expect top tier performance from it.

column1: ... this phone for 2 months now and I really love it. I had a Samsung before and hated ...
column2: I have owned this phone for 2 months now and I really love it. I had a Samsung before and hated it died. This Blu Studio was seamless use from package opening to new downloads. The screen is vivid and clear, the pictures are actually much better than expected and video calls have been fantastic. I love that Skype works so well. Of course I wish it was slightly bigger, but I was staying within a budget. You just can't go wrong. Although I don't need 2 SIMS its nice to have that option. My only complaint would be how flimsy the inside slip covers are for the SD Card. You have to be careful. The same goes for the SIM slots. Just be gentle or you will find you need a new phone. That is a drawback. But unless you need to take those out often, there is no worry. For under $100 it's alot of phone for the price.I will absolutely buy BLU products again and may just give this to my son and get a slightly bigger one for Mommy. Bottom line, I love the feel of it, the clear sound and picture and durability. Battery life is average.

column1: You get what you pay for
column2: This phone is a few years old at this point, and very cheap. For that reason, it might seem appealing to people looking for an unlocked phone to use on Straight Talk or a similar service. I owned this phone back in 2015, when it was hot off the press and let me tell you: Run the other way. This phone had an awful screen, was terribly slow, had ok battery life at best, and after a month of normal use the antenna stopped working. No more phone calls, 4G LTE, or anything. I trashed my unit and went on to a Motorola and never looked back to Blu.

column1: BLU Studio = No Bueno save your money!!
column2: I finally give up. This blu Studio is just no good. I originally ordered the phone on June 30 two day shipping. The phone arrived partially charged But I put it on the charger to achieve a complete charge any ways. Two days later I hit the wake up button and got nothing, the phone never woke up. I tried several chargers thinking "oh, maybe it went dead". The phone never came back on. I sent the phone back to Amazon asking for a replacement since I was already out $16 for a sim card for this model.Two days later the replacement arrived, 5 days (after a full charge) I pulled the phone off my bed and "NOTHING". Put it on a charger for 2 hours.... Nothing. So here I sit writing Amazon for a replacement, preferably a different phone by a better known manufacturer. Skip this model. If you are hard pressed for a budget phone spring for the BLU Play. Or just avoid BLU all together because this being my 3rd phone in 6 months (no replacement giving on the 1st one by BLU) The phones are affordable, pretty and when the work they are awesome but the manufacturers are irresponsible and these pretty phones just don't last. I've had 3 in a 7 month period, you do the math.

I've owned this phone for almost a year now. There's been several little glitches along the way but none so annoying as the touchscreen registering more than one touch on the screen. I will end up replacing the phone because this behavior has gotten much worse recently but it's done it since Day 1. Just keep it in mind that you get what you pay for, and if you understand that this is a cheap phone, you won't be disappointed.In the end: the phone still works- but the case is so thin that it has bent slightly, causing a slight curve to the touchscreen- the source of my frustration. If you treat this phone like it could possibly fold and don't place it in your pocket for everyday carrying, you should be alright. The touchscreen flexing could be from the cheaper components but all in all, it still works well. I'm adding an extra star to my review since I found out WHY the touchscreen got glitchy ;)

column1: Not as good as I thought
column2: My wife is on her second phone, first one returned after 4 months (could not keep connected to bluetooth, and txt messages were not going or coming in). Received "Factory New" phone (I highly doubt that) from BLU as a replacement and the same thing is happening. I asked them to send me a UPS label to ship the 2nd phone back to them with the same problem - "its against company policy to send a shipping label - you will have to cover the cost to send it in, as we cover the cost to ship it back to you." What a load of crap!! This model is defective, and they probably know it - I think they are playing roulette with this model and every once in a while you come up a winner.I have other BLU phones (different model) that connect to the bluetooth devices that this phone is having problems with. Plus the other phones can send and receive txts in the same area that this one is having problems with. So these issues are with this model - not with other devices or the area that I am in (cell coverage).

column1: SIM and SD are a little tricky but smooth sailing after that. Great Value
column2: arrived same day. good looking, large high def colorful screen. as mentioned in previous posts, the SIM and MICRO SD is a little challenging. i spent about 20 minutes on this. I have a micro SIM and needed to use my adapter to fit into the slot in a rectangular position. I was trying with just the Micro SIM at first and it was not starting up.The trickiest install is the SD card. The aluminum 'gate' actually flips up in the air once you push it forward to unlock it. You can then place the card in its spot. You can not push the card into place with the gate latched down. (I tried this many times) Once the card is in place, you have to pull gate back again to lock it down. Hope that helps some people.I think the source of some of the negative reviews is the above process that some can't get through.after that it was a smooth startup on my AT&T/Cricket service

Let me start off. Its not an s5, but it will give an excellent run for the money. At 1/4 the cost of the S5, who cares? The Camera does suck a bit, as its not even the claimed 5mp quality. battery life is pretty good but will depend on your usage. Speakers sound crappy but ive never heard ANY compact device speakers that sound good. Works on T-Mobile, at&t, and GSM affiliates. just put in sim and go. GOOGLE PLAY IS FACTORY INSTALLED. Please bear in mind, ANY device will break if its abused or mishandled. this is no exception, nor is it the devices fault. So with this in mind, IF YOU WANT AN S5, BUY AN S5. IF YOU WANT TO SAVE $500 get this.SPECIAL NOTES REGARDING AMAZON.PURCHASES ONLY: the price fluctuates on this device regularly. buy it, then watch pricing very closely. ask for refund when it adjusts lower. ALSO..AMAZON doesn't "pack" this item to ship it. they basically put a bookcover around the BLU mfg packaging. you may be sending it back because of amazon's poor packaging!

column1: Died after exactly one week!  RMA issued by BLU.
column2: Bought new from Cell4Sale! through Amazon. Arrived in a few days to my son's address. To be fair I didn't open it up until I arrived back to my home in Panama which was beyond Amazons one month return policy. It worked for exactly one week. Charged overnight but would not power up. Tried various chargers to no avail. Contacted Amazon who told me to contact seller, (as it was beyond the 30 day return policy), Who told me to contact Blu at their 800-number. No luck calling 800 number over 2 days, but was able to make contact with BLU threw their website.First response from BLU they ask me to do a total phone reboot which did not work. Second response after two days included a RMA number to return phone, which emphatically stated they will see if it is covered under warranty.To be continued...Took a chance after reading the reviews-guess I was in the percentage that didn't work.

It is really a great phone for the price. I am not a smartphone super user so someone else's experience may be different. I mostly just text, occasionally call, and occasionally use apps. I recently switched to one of the new AT&T payment plans that doesn't include a phone and I needed something functional without breaking the bank. This phone was a great find and I will probably buy a BLU again if I need to.I previously had a Samsung Galaxy S2. Obviously this phone is better with respect to hardware so it was an upgrade for me. The rear camera is good for what I need. (I haven't used the front facing camera.) It runs navigation from Google Maps no problem. Internet, via Chrome, and my Gmail all work very well with Wi-Fi or network.One complaint that I have is that the bottom of the screen, just above the home/back/more buttons, often does not pick up on touches. So buttons at the bottom of an app can be difficult to use. Often I have to rotate the phone to be able to push a button. I haven't had any issues using the keyboard, even the keys at the bottom, so I am not sure what the issue is.I have owned this phone for 2 months.I highly recommend this phone.

column1: Good smartphone for seniors or pre-teens
column2: I ordered this phone, for my 77 year old mother. She doesn't watch movies, surf the internet, play games or sends text messages. Therefore, she doesn't need a 4G LTE smartphone. This phone came unlocked, all I did was insert her AT&T Sim card, and it was good to go. This phone is a 3G phone, so connecting to the internet is slower. But, it also connects to WiFi, which is a plus. I downloaded a few apps from Google Play store, and they work without a problem. The screen on this phone is bright enough for her to see. She hasn't made a call yet on the phone, so can't talk about call quality. In my opinion, this would make a good pre-teen or senior citizen phone.

column1: If BLU isn't on your radar, it should be
column2: An impressive phone. Feature rich and a real bargain.My wife and I were Verizon customers for a long time and decided to leave for Straight Talk after our contract expired in order to save money (right up front, YES this phone works with Straight Talk!). When we switched, the original plan was for me to get a new phone and my wife carry her existing phone over to the new service. I got a Samsung Centura (an inexpensive but basic smart phone offered through Straight Talk) and my wife was going to keep her Droid 4...except that the Droid 4 turned out to be incompatible with Straight Talk (thus far). Due to the Droid 4's difficulties, we began to search for a replacement phone that could match or exceed the Droid 4's features without having to spend too much.Enter the BLU Studio 5.0 II. When we first came across this phone we were wondering if there was a connection to Stephen Dorff and e-cigarettes because we had never heard of BLU the cell phone brand. However, once we started reviewing this phone's features against its pricing we were impressed and wished we knew about BLU sooner. Hand's on, the Studio 5.0 II in white is clean and has a quality feel to it. The five-inch screen is bright and clear and yet the phone itself feels lighter than one might expect. The phone runs Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean and has plenty of horsepower, resulting in fluid graphics and menu transitions. Easily faster performing than my wife's Droid 4 and its Verizon bloatware. Sound is good...for a phone. How good could it really be, right? Though it was nice that the phone came with a matching set of ear buds. An interesting use out of this is the phone's ability to play FM radio via an included app. Any ear buds will work and the radio can still play through the main speakers (ear buds double as an antenna?). And, of course, as a phone the Studio 5.0 II works very well. The phone uses GSM technology and SIM cards (in fact it has two SIM card slots if that's useful for people). Under Straight Talk my wife used an AT&T-compatible SIM card and it runs at 4G. I downloaded the Ookla speed test app and got as high as ~8.4 Mbps download and ~1.1 Mbps upload speeds under 4G.The only real downside to the phone is that I don't have one for myself yet. Sure, my Centura was cheaper but, had I known about the Studio 5.0 II sooner I think we would have made two purchases. Live and learn. Still, the Studio 5.0 II is cheap enough that I can justify upgrading myself much sooner than later versus if I wanted to "aspire" to a more expensive phone, such as an iPhone. Seriously though, my wife has only had two real reservations about the phone: the lack of a physical keyboard, which the old Droid 4 offered, and relatively low camera resolutions. Little could be done about a physical keyboard of course given the perpetual trend away from real buttons on smartphones. As for the cameras, the main camera takes a decent picture but it is only five megapixels which is lower than her old Droid 4. The front-facing camera is simple "VGA" as described. The only complication I ever encountered was with installing a 32GB micro SD card for my wife for additional storage capacity in the phone. I got the SD card installed but the spring or clamp or whatever it is that holds the card in place was extremely firm and I was afraid I was going to break the card. Fortunately it didn't. Still, if you plan on installing a micro SD card, be careful and hope you don't have to change it often because it also requires the removal of the battery to install/uninstall.So, to summarize:Pros:-Price (about $120 when we bought it)-Performance (processing speed, 4G data rate)-Android 4.2.2 Jellybean-Nice screen size-Thin, lightweight-Quality build-Included extras (matching ear buds, matching charger/data cable, clear protective gel case, screen protector)-Straight Talk/AT&T compatibility confirmedCons:-Cameras could be better-Careful with your micro SD card!-Only one GB of internal storage (see update)*UPDATE* July 01, 2014:Phone is still going strong. Something I forgot to emphasize earlier because we already have a large SD card for this phone is storage capacity. The phone started having some low storage warnings even though we have an SD card installed because we forgot to set the external SD card as the default storage location. Be aware that the BLU Studio 5.0 II only has ONE GB of internal storage, so getting a micro SD card is a must if you don't already have one. While micro SD cards are relatively cheap (Class 10 32 GB for under $20 on Amazon right now) a couple of extra GBs of internal storage would be useful to start with.

column1: Buyer Beware.. you just might get a dud!
column2: At first, I wasn't going to review this phone because I don't like to be negative, but I have to, but only for the brand (Blue Studio 5.0). First, I ordered this phone last August for my daughter.When it arrived we had to send it back because after three days it starting to act weird (the screen jumped and lines went across the entire phone).So, to be fair we sent a replacement and refunded my money back!I can't complain about that because Amazon handled it well...however....within months the phone was acting up again.This time something different, the screen is fine, but the everytime she tries to write anything the letters are jumping everywhere and she can't even send a text.So, to all those considering buying a Blu Studio 5.0 II just be careful, you might get a dud.

column1: Great phone at a great price.
column2: I have an account that is advertised for old people. You know the one. I got this phone to be able to see the screen better than the Defy I was using. This phone is great. I get 4G speeds, the display is awesome (equal to my wife's Galaxy, regardless of what the reviews say), much faster and more stable than my Motorola. The only thingi would mark it down on was that there are very few cases available for it. That not the Blu's fault there just isn't. But I compared its dimensions with 30 or 40 phones and found the Galaxy 5.0 Active is less than a mm different in all directions. I picked up a nice case for an Active, melted a couple extra holes in it with a hot nail that didn't match the access points and I was all set. I am very pleased with the phone.

I got this phone as a budget smartphone for work. So far, so good. The phone works great with StraightTalk, although the APN settings took five hours and a great deal of Internet searching to set correctly.The phone itself seems to be of good quality, seems solid and well-built. At 512mb of RAM it is a bit lagging on system speed, but if I needed a blazing fast phone I would have bought one. I've had some problems syncing audio files to play through Spotify and other media players, but I'll figure it out eventually. A SD card is a must as you only have about 1.5gb of space on the phone's internal memory. For the price, this thing seems like a great bargain for a superior product.

column1: I have this phone for about a month now and ...
column2: I have this phone for about a month now and I didn't know what to expect at first. that sound is clear and the picture is sharp...plusthe processor is very fast. Idownloaded movies and watchedquite a few with no problems as faras slowness and glitches etc...willupdate again in a couple of monthsor so...Have this phone for almost3 months now...No problem detected and I downloaded Clean Master to keep it running in tip top shape. I have added applications and there is no slow down. The phone reception and sound is crispy clear. I only wish there was more than 1 gig of internal memory because some of the apps I downloaded cannot be stored in

As promised below, I have returned to give you an update on this phone. I have had it for over two months and I still absolutely love it. It is great. Battery life is fantastic and I truly feel I got a considerable value for the money I spent. My wife's phone is at the end of its life and I am getting another one for her! I have had no problems with it whatsoever and would buy another BLU product without hesitation!I have had this phone for a week and I love it. It fits in a dress shirt pocket or any shirt pocket just fine. I keep my display screen toward the inside of the pocket so that the display does not get scratched by a pen or pencil.The screen is brilliant and the phone feels good in the hand. I coupled this with a Straight Talk sim card and for the price, I could not be happier. My only hope is that it lasts, , , , time will tell. I may be back in a few months to update this review.Here are a few things I experienced that I want to share.* This phone takes the larger (not the micro) sim card.* The tiny little manual that comes with the phone comes was printed in a very very small font and it is very generic. I did not find it to be very useful. A note in the box with an address for a manual in PDF or a tutorial on Youtube would have been nice. I have owned other cell phones, so I kind of knew the routine to get started.* I carefully removed the battery cover at its starter notch with a medium thickness guitar pic and that seemed to work well. The cover is very tight which I'm happy with.* I had to be careful about which sim card slot I was using. I mistook slot 2 for slot 1. No big deal to swap it though. The sim slots are marked in very very tiny print on each slot. I think the diagram in the phone is printed upside-down.* I discovered I needed to slide the Micro SD cover horizontally with my finger to unlock the Sim card holder.* Straight Talk was good about providing the APN numbers that I needed to get started. The only problem I had then was attaching photos in mms, ,BUT, , , then, I went to the BLU website and they show how to address that issue in their very first FAQ question at their support forum.Voila!Someone else wrote it took them hours in another review somewhere to resolve their setup and several fellow reviewers helped point me in the right direction. I hope my experiences shared here can save you a little time if this is your first BYOP to Straight Talk (or some other GSM provider as well). Thanks to information that other reviewers left for me, this was very easy to set up.Battery life is great but keep in mind, this phone has a 5 inch screen and so far, I have not found anything about this phone that I dislike. For the price, I got an incredible amount of smartphone, earbuds, screen protector and phone cover in the box. The 5 inch screen is huge and this has become both my smartphone and tablet!

column1: My first impression is that it's cheaply built but for what I paid it's fine. The phone is fast
column2: Ok, so I got this phone yesterday. My first impression is that it's cheaply built but for what I paid it's fine. The phone is fast. Instruction book can use a little bit more improvement. It took me awhile to figure out how to insert the SD card but the rest was easy. I tried using the internet with T-mobile and I found out that T-Mobile did not update my account with data plan so after I called and got it taken care of the phone access the internet with no problem. In fact, it's faster than my Samsung Galaxy S2.The screen resolution is fine since I'm not picky. Everything work as expected. BTW, I'm sure if they sent me a brand new phone since the screen protector is already on.

The dual sim is a great feature, especially for travel around the world.It's durable and fast.Not without some quarks with certain apps, but I've had much worse with a verizon driod x 2.The camera works well and the options for wifi hotspot and VPN are handy when traveling.Theregular 3.7v battery lasts several days without use and at least a day with heavy use.The sms software is difficult to use, so I installed hangouts and set it up to take over the sms.This phone was wonderful for 1 1/2 years until it stopped turning on.It's been a good phone for the cost, although I give it 3 stars for the short lifespan.

column1: Tried to Reboot Phone and It Died
column2: I bought this phone as a low cost alternative when my HTC One got wet and died. I was unemployed at the time, so I was on a budget. Phone has only 512MB of RAM, so simply running the latest incarnation of FB would make it grind to a halt. The phone would often slow down to the point where my screen and menu interactions would take a few seconds to catch up. I would then re-boot the phone and it would be a bit better. Well a few days ago, I had the same problem. I pushed the power button, selected 'Reboot' and it powered down. It never came back. Won't even take power from the charger. Only used the phone for 6 months.

column1: I love the fact that it's unlocked and I can use ...
column2: Unfortunately I haven't had a chance to use this phone yet. I have to wait until my Verizon acct is up. Which is March 7.I have been playing around with it though (puting in contacts etc).It seems to work fantastically.The battery so far seems to last forever compared to my current phone.I love the fact that it's unlocked and I can use it on any carrier I want to.I have been price shopping GSM companies which has been fun.I had no idea there are so many different cell phone companies out there.With what I know about this phone so far I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family.Thank youShane Caddo

First time buyer of a smart phone, Had it 20 days and still can't get it to work right. The instructions come in a very small booklet made for ants to read. Tried using a magnifying glass - Found a tutorial hidden on the Blu products site. It was the worst manual I have ever read. It assumes you know all the nomenclatureof all abbreviations and icons, so they don't explain or show drawing of them. My wife bought a ZTE phone about the same time and it came with a big fold out set of instruction. I tried using them but some things aren't the same. I'm giving up and will send it back. Glad I bought it thru Amazon.

The phone is excellent for the price ratio. It is not Samsung quality nor I-phone but it is great for those on budget.Has many available capabilities (android apps), great display, however cameras are not the best but OK and sound quality acceptable as it may have issues on speaker talk (echoes).Phone is excellent for busy people that use it as basic every day functions ( calls, occasional pics -work related, recordings, tabulate to do list, schedule, check weather, check email, text, video chat via Skype).

column1: I've owned so many top shelf devices and always had to have the best phone out until I decided to give up paying ...
column2: First time writing a review here, I've just gotten this phone a few days ago after reading all of the reviews about it, I don't see how anyone can have an issue with this product,I've owned so many top shelf devices and always had to have the best phone out until I decided to give up paying top shelf prices so I took a chance with this as my LG G2 became a brick through rooting and endless mods, I can honestly say that this is the BEST PHONE I've ever had, I absolutely love this thing, it was kinda boring looking with stock home launcher but go launcher ex does wonders with this phone and as long as BLU stays in business I'll be buying their phones. Switch from LG to BLU and never looking back. Phone is amazing! Coming from a tech savvy android OS wizard

I have had this phone about a month...andlet me tell you IT ROCKS! Does eeverythinga regular cell phone does. I did not have any issues setting it up. Just make sure when you go to set it up to make sure you turn off the ",China" setting. I switched from net10 to the go phone with no issues at all. Set up was simple...battery life is a little low but I also have a few games and apps running in the back ground. So I'm sure if I cleared the cache on them and turned them off it would be fine other wise. All in all its a great phone. I'm glad I bought it!

column1: had to replace 3 times tech support.
column2: I don't know what's wrong with the battery's on these phone n less that a week's time I had to order 3 replacement phone. The first one just shut off n never cut back on. And the second phone stop holding charge and eventually stop working. The new one I got today the speaker's stop working I have to put the phone on speaker to talk on it because when not on speaker I van hear them but they can hear me. I'm so peeved that I hadto replreplace this phone. Once u hey the phone on n using it is pretty cool work well with T-Mobile n family mobile. Okay camera easy to use and nice big screen and keyboard is easy to use. This phone would be awesome if hadn't have to replace it again. Will not buy another blu do to the fact I had so many problems with it. I'm going to try windows phone hopefully it will work for me.. Ugh

Good smartphone for international use, if you are going to foreign country and dont want to risk loosing your expensive phone, this is a good option. It has dual SIM, so you can install your US sim and a local sim. The camera is ok.. it dont like it that much. Battery life so so, 3g works great. I was able to do voice call over 3g using viber. Overall not bad for $100 unlocked dual sim smart phone. It shows 4G HSPA on the subject line when its listed on amazon, but I dont think it has 4g, I never saw 4g coverage in DFW area... This is the 2nd phone the first one became defective after 15 days of use and I returned it to amazon, got and they re-send me a 2nd one, which is working fine for over a month now. Guys its $100 phone so dont expect Samsungs performance out of this. I mainly use it when I travel overseas espically in developing countries.

Had to return this phone.Dropped calls and would not function properly with automated call handling systems (you know, push 2 for English, etc.) Phone sent phantom signals to call centers (tried more than one) as if I was speaking replies or pushing buttons when in fact I was not even touching the phone or speaking sitting in a quiet room. This happen'd on more than one occasion.I loved the large display. Functionality was "ok" not as intuitive as the Galaxy products which is what I went back to and I am very happy with my Galaxy S4.

column1: If you buy one there is a year manufacturer warranty on it so it would be best to just send it in before someone open's it ...
column2: While this phone functions well I won't buy another one. The parts are too hard to find AND just the simple task of replacing a screen can and probably will open the door to other problems with this phone. This phone is made soo cheaply made that just opening it up could do more damage, It is not worth it. Many repair shops won't work on them at all. If you buy one there is a year manufacturer warranty on it so it would be best to just send it in before someone open's it up.I wanted to buy another but will not. Good Luck.

I was looking for a personal phone with HD screen.I have a new work phone LG G2 4G, and really liked screen size and HD resolution. Was looking for G2 for myself, but didn't want to spent so much as G2 4G would cost me. Found BLU Studio 5.0 II---this phone has the sameandroid OS version, screen size, resolution, processor speed and memory as G2 .The BLU Studio 5.0 II came with a case, screen protector and headphones, and did not cost me "an arm and a leg". LOVE IT! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a new HD screen phone.

It is a great phone - especially if you not only want "just the phone," but a good navigation tool, multimedia player, etc. etc. The phone reception is somewhat worse than Motorola's Droid, but the GPS is better, and with a larger screen it is a boon to find yourself in an unfamiliar place.This phone enabled us to make our first trip without any paper maps - in Buenos Aires, Argentina. And with two SIM card slots, I could pick whichever I wanted for data roaming and international long distance calls.

This phone was a waste of my money. I got it unlocked for use when I travel overseas. The seller was very efficient in getting the product my way -brand new I will also point out. The phone worked excellent on the first week of my 2 weeks abroad and on the 2nd week simply stopped working altogether. It just refused to turn on. Took it to get checked out and the technician said it was broken. I was very disappointed to spend the rest of the trip with no phone. I'm not sure what to make of it, perhaps it was just a faulty one. Since I only needed it for short periods when I traveled I thought it would be a good buy, however I would definitely suggest investing in a more reliable brand.

I have used the phone for a few weeks now. The phone is of decent quality and is all and more than what you expect for a phone costing under $100. The phone came with a charger, screen protector, case, ear buds and usb. The on off button is a little too recessed so it takes some getting use to. I would pull the phone out and end up dragging my finger along the side several times before finding it. I purchased a protective type case that has a raised rubber button so that issue is now gone.

Got this phone for my honey and it arrived yesterday. So far he really likes the phone and it does all that is promised. The look is sleek and classy and there is no difference in appearance from other higher priced phones. It is easy to set up the dual SIM cards. But the SD card is a bit problematic to install.There is a small metal clip to the far left that must be opened by gently pushing up (towards the top of the phone or in the same direction of the arrow) that you must needs to be raised before it can be installed.The dual SIM is a very nice feature as you can keep contacts and information from more than one source. The Bluetooth and GPS Navigator both work well.If you see a message at the a message at the bottom that says "no service" next to the name ofyour provider, (eg. T-Mobile) don't be alarmed, it's because you have two SIM cards and you did not activate service on both. It will go away if the phone has two service providers.I THINK THIS IS A GREAT FEATURE especially if you travel. You can use your U.S. SIM and a local provider SIM.Things that can be improved are: higher volume, especially for the ringers; definitely more storage space, 1GB is seriously inadequate for today's high paced/high tech world; the camera needs improvement (both front and back) Pics indoor even with the flash and lighting is not crisp and clear; increasing the MPX to about 10 would readily solve this issue; and adding about 1.5 or so pixel to the front facing instead of a VGA would help a great deal.The speed is great and getting on the internet is fast and easy whether for email; Facebook, Google or anything else. There are no issues with messaging whether instant or hangouts although I saw comments that there were lag times.Despite a few negatives, I really like this phone and so does my hubby and we will get another one gladly.It is a great phone for the money if you can live with the few shortcomings mentioned above. My goal was to get a phone, not a camera or a computer, per se, so it does just fine.

column1: ... time wasn't anywhere close to on time and a better phone. The BS 5
column2: The phone did arrive on time which was shocking because the life play 2 that I bought the first time wasn't anywhere close to on time and a better phone. The BS 5.0ll oh were to beginFor android is very basic lacks features compaired to lp2.The battery that came with the BS 5.0 ll checked out good until I gave it the first full charge then found the red cross hatch of death, I haven't had time to contact manufacturer or company it was shipped from to see about a replacement.The camera is as expected video and movie perfect picture when its not buffering which it does quite a bit even on WiFi.I think I'm a have ta rate the bs right up there with the cheap straight talk phones you buy from Wally world which is what I had before the lp2.Why the change you ask? The straight talk was junk from the get go but didn't have much choice couldn't afford to do the contract with Sprint any longer plus I shattered my screen on that one and I was tired of paying 150.-- deductible for a refurbished junk phone anyway we we all know where this is going.Sound quality is fair my wife's GS3 is way better.The RAM on the bs5.0 needs to be bumped way up by the time you add a few of your favorite apps then you start getting updates and all (WOW) this thing is as slow as if not slower than dial up speed. I would go back to my lp2 but I forgot I had it in my pocket one day and yup shattered the screen on that one too dam the luck.So if you want a phone that's simple and don't like a lot of apps that runs slow and takes decent pics oh yeah and comes with a junk battery.Idk maybe its just my luck don't get me wrong I was very impressed with my lp2 up until I broke it.

column1: I would not recommend it solely on the fact that there were so ...
column2: This phone started to have major glitches only a few days after the warranty on Amazon expired. I contacted the Blu Phone Company and by the time they were able to help me all hope was lost for Amazon to possibly exchange it. I would not recommend it solely on the fact that there were so little resources when the glitches started. The little assistance that I received led me to an inevitably catastrophic programming menu.The phone’s first sign of demise occurred with the screen freezing. As this happened with my past phones when I had too many apps on it, I assumed rebooting and uninstalling apps would help. But, I continuously had to reboot throughout the day even when my storage was decreased and cache cleared.The next sign, I would describe as an exaggerated form of the first. It started after I turned it back on after an exam; every time I locked my phone by turning off the screen I was no longer able to turn the screen back on. The touch sensors worked and the touch buttons on the bottom remained lit.The final stage of my phones catastrophic cascade led me to finally turn on my old “brick-like” phone from three years ago. I am no longer able to get past the first opening chime where the, now hated word, “BLU” is displayed. It just simply turns on and stays on that screen display regardless if I push and hold power. I have to take out the battery to turn it off.Every once in a while I will take it out of its box and turn it on in the hope that time will heal its many wounds. But no, it taunts me every time I turn it on by displaying “BLU.”I went on a mission trip to Haiti and recognized BLU phones are owned by many Haitians. I had good hopes for the capabilities of my smart phone after seeing how sturdy the simpler models were.~Abby Lengenfelder~

column1: Piece of Junk and it doesn't work at all (1st. & 2nd. phone)
column2: This is a piece of junk.Don't buy this phone, otherwise you will waste your time.This was my second attempt to see if this new phone would work but it didn't.Both times, it did not read my SIM card and it did not read my SD memory card at all.It showed that both of them were defective.A brand new phone it's not supposed to do that. No matter what you guys see all the good reviews on youtube, don't believe them. Probably a bunch of them are cheap and may fail in the near future.

I bought this phone for my 12 year old son so that he could have more communication for us and a way to give him an additional responsibility. When it arrived I was surprised that it was much larger than I expeted. Screen is of nice reolution. Maybe not HD but good enough, unless you are planning to see HD videos on it its good. Brightness is good and connectivity seems good as well. I am on an oil rig right now and won't be able to test the double sim function properly but so far so good. I know my son will defintely like it.

Works and Looks just as nice as the Samsung Galaxy S5 (even better). I use this with Straight Talk $45.00 plan and I could not be Happier. Straight talk uses the AT&T network which has excellent coverage in my area. Visit You Tube for complete reviews and making Mods to work more efficiently with Straight Talk. This Phone comes with a really nice protective shell and it has saved my phone a few times. Fell from about 4-5 feet on solid concrete and not even a scratch. Buy this phone you will not go wrong.

column1: Look For something with better quality, I guess you get what you pay for, which is still a lot!!
column2: I originally was pleased with this phone, until I started having problems with it and the Speaker stopped working on it, so that the only way I could hear anything was with the headphone jack.A few weeks after that happened, the phone stopped recognizing my sim card, (Due to this, I have not had any service for two plus weeks) in addition to that after attempting to swap out the sim card between slots and trying multiple device resets, it still doesn't work.Then my mini-SD card quit being able to be read and I noticed that one side of the housing for that had come unsoldered (at least I hope it was soldered in).I tried contacting Amazon and they said that I cannot get a refund or exchange as I am outside the allowed return window, but shouldn't any electronic device still have a one year warranty for manufacturer's defects? I could understand if it was used or refurbished, but this is a new phone.

I don't like writing reviews, but I've done everything else in hopes of having to avoid this option, but no luck.I bought this as a gift for someone, but I had to wait for the person's birthday to come, so long story short, the person received their gift, and within 3 days the phone stopped working. No drop, no spill. We thought probably it was a battery problem, so put it to charge, no luck there. Try contacting seller, no such option. So, what next?

Loved this phone.Unfortunately I broke it one weekend while on a fishing trip.Still worked fine but I didn't like having a phone with a crack across the screen.Fortunately, I had a friend who had a phone where the screen was totally smashed and unusable so I gave mine to her and bought a new one for myself.They're just not that expensive (and now I have a pretty girl who thinks I'm wonderful).I highly recommend this phone.

column1: Plays Bible.is a while, then does strange things.
column2: First the good parts, it is pretty, has even screen lighting & colors, it gets ATT in our house with minimal probems while my wife's Nexus shows 0 or 1 bar & drops calls every day.Sound is usually good but can be terrible.Just stand still and retry call for better sound.Arrived in nice box with clear silicon cover and screen protector film.Now the bad parts, Blu said reload Bible.is & I did.Bible.is is what we listen to every night till breakfast.This phone flashes a screen of Bible.is every time it wakes, fails to play Bible.is thru night, does not show text along with spoken text.It took a week to download all of ESV Bible, then hid or lost the 66 Bible boks of audio.Another week of downloading got ESV Bible playing strangely but phone switched to KJV Bible. Most USB cables fall out, a few hold jack tightly.Camera may be reject from production of other phones.No flash control, no macro mode, no picture quality regardless of setting.This phone does strange things, more than just making calls when it wants to any one in address book.Unlock usually starts dialer, sometimes camera, somtimes just unlocks to home screen.Bible.is is the app I use most, by far most, so phone will be returned.Blu web has nice comparison screens to choose a phone.Possibly this is a good phone design, good parts & some memory problem but I will get another model.

column1: Phone completely malfunctioned after just a few months.  Customer service less than responsive...........
column2: Phone is loaded with features but malfunctioned after only three months negating any and all advertised features. The battery capacity is also questionable as it barely makes it through a normal day with minimal talk time being used.Attempts to obtain a replacement phone have been unsuccessful and still awaiting a response from customer service after three days.I have already purchased a competitors replacement phone not knowing when Blu will respond.UPDATE 10/18/2014: I returned the malfunctioning phone to Blu and approximately two weeks later I received a replacement phone which was refurbished. After only three days, yes just three days later, it began to malfunction and froze numerous times.The phone would not respond to any commands, touch and hard buttons. The only way to get it to work again was to remove the battery and wait for it to "reboot". Needless to say this was very frustrating. At one point the screen displayed a service technician's menu without any prompts or buttons pushed by me. I gave up on the customer no-service from Blu and dealt directly with Amazon who was very helpful. Obviously by looking at the number/percentage of bad reviews it appears my experience was the norm for a Blu phone.

I hate this phone! The phone is a great size. Takes nice pictures. Adjustable volume is a nice feature. However, this phone likes to shut itself off. Will NOT connect to data no matter how many times I have tried to set it up. It flips from ring to vibrate by itself. Every time I come into an area that someone's WiFi is available it goes to the shut off screen.

I don't know who write the reviews for these phones, but I don't find these phone very reliable. The first one had a total display failure a few months after I had used it. It took almost two months for them to finally replace it. I had also bought a second phone on which the camera no longer works after a few months of use. I do not recommend these phone as a reliable product.You're better off with a name brand phone form a dealer with good warranty support.

Great phone for the price. Love the large size of the screen. Screen quality is good and speakers are nice and loud. I originally bought the Blu Advance 4.0 phone but didn't like the quality of the screen on that one and returned it for this phone, which is way better. This is literally like a samsung phone but way cheaper, plus the screen is slightly bigger. Battery life is good and charges fast. Haven't found anything I don't like about it yet. I have not tested the cameras yet, as I don't use those much. Good enough to be used as a primary phone and not just a back up. Very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend.

column1: i was completely in love with this
column2: Hello there!I'm from Venezuela and i buy this phone.In the place before it came to my hands, i was completely in love with this. All my friends told my amazing stuff for this phone. (And i was very time without a phone, so i was impatient)Is soo big, and is like having a tablet in your hand. I like that, is so much easy to write.The processor is very good, easy, without shackles.The screen is even good that the Galaxy S3.The battery never gave me troubles, is enough for one day.The best thing in this phone, is what it gives to you when you buy it:-Headphones.-Charger.-Screen protector.-Silicon Case.And the user guide and stuff like that.The shipping time is very quick, and the phone came's beautiful way. Perfect presentation.I recomend this phone to all my friends, people i know, and people i don't know. (like you, for example)Five stars!

column1: if you want quality high end but not the price this is for you
column2: where to start on this item i ordered one for my aunt after i got one its a great price awesome picture quality does screen shots but took me a min to find out how to do it it has a nice big screen i have only one complaint about not having screen shot but them i figured it out i will upgrade to a better blu studio when i up grade my phone again i have a blu studio 5.0 thats a little bigger and i love it

ultra fast shipping ! Set up was very smooth....Really love this phone. I cannot find anything to complain about. The things I like the most is the excellent touch screen which make navigating a breeze . Screen resolution and color are very good also .The camera is good for general purpose phone display/storage and email,uploading etc. As I mentioned before no hang ups to date.....I am Happy !!!Thank you.

I like the overall style of the phone. It is set up just like the Samsung Galaxy, so it was fairly easy to work if you are familiar with that phone. I gave the phone only 3 stars because the phone I received was defective! I push one thing, the phone selects something totally different! I would have to push one letter on the keyboard over and over before it would get it right. The phone would also often delete my emails while I'm trying to read them, and I was unable to open files and attachments. Because I bought this phone for business, I just couldn't afford the time and effort in trying to get it to work properly. I am sending the phone back for a refund.....

I purchased this item as a Christmas gift for my mom, she's only had it for a day now and cannot keep her hands off. Had an minor issue with transferring the phone over to Metro PCS, as it would not connect to the internet. However, it was definitely the Metro PCS representative's fault because they did not transfer the APN over to the carriers network. Other than that, no complaints as of now! I will make a purchase for myself after about a month of seeing how my mother's phone perform. Hope this helps

column1: Good Phone for the Price. But Be Aware.
column2: This phone is a good phone for the price.According to my son it does everything his Galaxy 5 can do and more.I gave it 3 stars for 2 reasons: First, I had to return the phone to Amazon for a replacement after 2 days because the original phone stopped working. Amazon replaced it in a timely manner. So far the new phone works fine.Second, some of my friends say I sound strange when the phone is in speaker mode. The phone sounds much better when I use my Bluetooth or ear buds.It should also be noted: The manufacturer of BLU products doesn't answer their phone. I waited on hold for over 2 hours (Yes...I timed the call). They did respond to my email two days later.

column1: This is a very good phone
column2: Wow I was surprised by the fit and finish of the phone, it functioned right of the box, I installed the TMobile sim card and the phone worked the first time. Why are we chasing after the Samsung and Apple, when there's another player in the game. The phone functions just like any Samsung phone, with the only noticed difference was the level of the volume, but it's a great phone for the money.

I love this phone! I used a Straight Talk SIM card and it works great! I was even able to set up a portable hotspot with this device which is great because I'm a college student with tons on homework. The only problem was that I had to manually program the phone to the Straight Talk data network and I could never get MMS to work, but I'm sure I can figure it out. I loved this phone so much I bought one for my mom and my aunt. They both love it as well, especially the front facing camera and portable hotspot.

column1: will not buy a BLU again.
column2: This is my 2nd BLU product, this 1 worked 3 months the other 6. they fixed this then returned it but now you need ear piece to hear. The 2nd they are stalling and have not responded to calls or e-mails to honor their warranty. If you want to spend $ for a short term phone than this is what you want. It sucks as the product is good while it last.

I purchased two of these phones for myself and my wife. We have Metro PCS as our provider and the transition between our old phone to this phone was simple . The phone is very user friendly and quite responsive and fast. I would reccommend this phone to anyone that wants a large screen without the large price tag. The call quality is fantastic. The only thing that I find a little annoying is that the phone buzzes when a call connects. I contacted Blu about this and was told that was bulit into phone and cannot be de-activated. Other than that one issue, the phone is great. Long battery life. I carry the phone with me all day off the charger and by the time I get in my car 9-10 hours later, the phone is still at 90%.Love the phone. Can't wait to see what other products Blu comes out with.

column1: Wish it could have worked out between us
column2: Good looking phone but it doesn't work. After a day of using the phone the screen became incredibly pixelated where the phone was not usable simply because you could not discern what the heck you are pushing. The size of the screen is nice though if you are looking for a larger phone. Unfortunately, it was not functional considering the technical problems so it went back. Disappointed!

column1: I Can Admit When I am Wrong
column2: My old phone was cracked, obsolete. After listening to my husband complain over and over how horrible it was ( let me admit now...it was bad) I finally relented and purchased this phone. Now my husband has a smug expression every time I gush about the phone. I was able to kill two birds with one stone: My husband gets to be right and I get a phone that lives up to expectations

column1: It did not work at all
column2: I bought this phone last year to take it overseas as a present to my cousin in Venezuela. I just went for few day, dropped for my cousin and left. The phone never worked. My cousin toked it to a BLUE representative and they told her it was refurbished, they tried to download the program and were not successful. BLU is the most use cell phone in Venezuela at this moment.Of course being Venezuela a difficult country to deal with couriers, my cousin had to wait until somebody came to US so she could returned it to me. Sadly I cannot returned it to Amazon because "its to late". Is the first time that I have an issue with Amazon but as a caution I will not recommend this item.
