column2: Good nightThe present is intended to inform you that model 1 buy them a cell phone BLU of BLU Studio 5.0 II Unlocked Dual SIM Phone with Dual-Core 1. 3 GHz Processor, Android 4.2 JB, 4 G HSPA + and 5MP Camera - WhiteSold by: Amazon.com LLC; Order #: 002-7807580-7205820Order date: June 26, 2014; case is that after a week used it phone presents the fault does not pass in its start-up: BLU PRODUCTS, does not make the return already this would be more expensive for my return that buy a new one: disappointing this purchase; The case is to take you to an agent authorised in my country (caracas-Venezuela) and they informed me that all BLU models that had requested technical support this model BLU Studio 5.0 II was the most defective, since only 50 cases had been unable to repair 3; even without knowing if the mine had repair.

column1: Great for the price you pay...
column2: This is a great phone to get if you can't afford the more trendy Android phones. The accessories that come with it are good and most phones that you buy from your service providers don't have gel cases enclosed. I bought a flip case just to have another option. I will say buy a SD storage card because this phone doesn't have a lot of storage space. Great buy for me!

I love this phone. My husband and I both have one. My only complaint is that when I first took it from the box the home button didn't work and I couldn't receive phone calls. For some reason a factory reset fixed everything and its been perfect ever since. The only app I've come across that does not work is game of war, freezes and forces out. Everyone

column1: for the price is a really good choice
column2: this cell phone is preaty big, the screen is the same size the galaxy s4, good quality, not as good as samsung but for the price you could see it as an very good option, i'd give it 4 stars because it has a very good performance but the camera does not take so very good pictures, thats the only problem at least for me, as I said before, for the price you're paying is a very good choice

column1: Nice phone but can't use it
column2: I ordered this phone for my mom but she is unable to use it. I bought it because I was under the impression that it could be used with any GSM carrier but we've tried two already and she is not able to use it. Straight talk says that this phone is not supported but she was able to call and text but No data (No picture messaging ). For AT&T, she can't even make calls. I'm not sure if it's just where she lives or if it's the phone itself. It works well with Wi-Fi though. It's a shame because she really likes the phone but she can't use it.

Take away the bull$h** of contracts, SIM locking to carriers, and fancy "finger print readers", build a solid Android device using a low-priced, but powerful chipset, now make sure to use IPS screens, next in Dual Sim capability,and lastly, offer the device at a great price.There, you have the BLU line of phones.BLU, Asus (with their line of ZenFones), and other companies are telling the consumer that the phone in their pocket doesn't have to be locked in to (or locked by) your Wireless Carrier and that it doesn't have to cost you the price of a high-end computer.This is a great trend and I wholeheartedly support it.The BLU Studio 5.0 II is in the lower end BLU's line of phones but it is still impressive for the price.The Good:-IPS screen means the screen is bright and has good viewing angles-SIM unlocked means you can use it for any carrier as long as the carrier bands are supported by the cellular chip-1900 Band for ATT and 1700 band for T-Mobile-Bloat-free Android 4.2 is fast, efficient, and full of great functionality without the additional crap put in by the major carriers.Really, do we need TV service from T-Mobile or ATT?- Solid build.Doesn't feel flimsy in your hand- Includes silicone case.- Dual Sim:Have one phone for work and one phone for personal use?Use one phone for both.Calls coming to and called from each card are clearly marked to minimize confusion.The Bad:-Low screen resolution.Coming from a Galaxy S3, the lower resolution took some getting used to.If this is important to you, look at the higher end BLU phones.-No LTE.To be expected for this price.No great loss for me since my LTE speeds usually are pretty poor anyway.-Some bad software settings (Reference my tips)-When using only 1 SIM card, there is always a warning in the notification bar that a second SIM is not inserted.Hopefully, they will address this with an update.TIPS:-Set the APN.The phone comes with a single APN pre-programmed, which is selected by default.The APN is the address that the phone passes through to get to the Internet.If you are having a problem with network connection, go in to Settings > Data Networks > Access Point Names and choose the APN for your carrier.Don't tap on the name of the APN, tap on the radio button to the right of it and make sure the bubble is filled in.-Only SIM1 can access the HSDPA+ network while the other SIM is limited to the EDGE network.This is not really an issue since only the Android OS will only use 1 SIM to access the Internet.You choose which SIM card ALL network traffic will go through so basically put the SIM that has the higher data limit in the SIM1 slot.-Rename the SIM cards in your settings to better differentiate the sim cards.Also select to display the SIM cards using the last 4 digits instead of the first 4 (three of which is your area code).So in summary, this is a solid phone with solid support for "mobile" usage (not so great for those who use their phone in lieu of a computer for everything they do on the Internet).The truth that Samsung doesn't want you to know is that there is really nothing on Android that requires an octacore CPU, or even takes advantage of it.In fact, while I have not tested XBMC on this phone, my Android HDMI Stick that also has the Mali 400 supports more codecs than Samsung's video chip.

Got the phone was very excited when it arrived but I was dissatisfied with it. Camera is poor quality unableto tex photo to my contacts and out going calls is terrible has to repeat my self repeteadly Drop calls and Muffling backgroundnoise are also common. I eventually have to buy a galaxy s5 just a waste of money to buy this phone period.

column1: so far so good on the simple mobile the phone is quite good ...
column2: so far so good on the simple mobile the phone is quite good like the huge screen fast watching netflix even without wi-fi also the photos on the rear camera are very clear tried the flash at night it is not good cannot see the images all in all for the price it is worth its money would buy again. Four stars due to weak camera flash

Great phone works just fine on Cricket. This phone continues to amaze me camera is great takes really great pictures. I can and do have tones of apps loaded and still have room for more.Battery lasts all day even when I do a lot of web browsing.Really great phone so good I am getting my wife one.

column1: Expected chinese junk, was pleasantly surprised.
column2: I upgraded from a samsung galaxy s and this phone is better in every aspect.Much beyond my expectations.large vibrant screen, good battery life, fast mutlitasking.only bad i have is that its hard to find cases and such, good thing these come with agel case and screen protector!If you're on the fence, buy it, you will be pleased

column1: Buy any phone but this one.
column2: I am being kind with one star. I have never had such a lemon in my life. I bought the phone in June and it is now October so I am to late for a refund. This phone was a pain in the but from the start. I had trouble getting a sim card to work and when you go to voice mail it gives you about 1 second to enter you pin number. iIt is very slow to load web pages and emails. The last straw was when it destroyed my 16Gb. sd card. I mean it is unusable and all my data is lost. I had a lot of pics and new contacts along with my kindle books that I had paid for and I'm not sure if I can retrieve them. I think Amazon may still allow me to get them as I did pay for them. I'm too pissed to try that now and I still have to decide if I am going to even keep this piece of crap. DO NOT BUY THIS ONE!

researched for about 3 months prior to purchasing my studio 5.0.. i was very leary about purchasing a phone from a company that i had never heard of before i started researching. however after reading reviews of this and other galaxy similar phones i found that the price and comparison of this one seemed to be the best for the money.long story short after havingmy phone for almost 2 months now i will absolutely buy more BLU phones it is a wonderful phona and does everything that i want it to and then some.as for the camera i see alot of ppl saying the camera sux.my conclusion, it takes decent pictures just like you expect from most phones if you want a camera then you pay for quality if you want something that takes pics on hand this is sufficient i like the pics it takes for a phone.

Liked the phone,it would freeze up and after 6 months it quit. The screen just went black. Called customer service for Blu and that is a joke. They would have let us send the phone back but there is now way to get you contacts off. My granddaughter just keeps the phone for nostalgia. Kids.

column1: Great comparison to the Galaxy S5, but dual SIM!!
column2: Got this for my mom, she lives internationally but travels to the US often. Main benefit is the dual sim. Otherwise it is just like my Galaxy S5 but for a fraction of the price. It is almost the same phone as far as appearance and functionality. I compared other BLU phones and other brands and ultimately went with this one.

I love this phone. It pretty much meets most of my expectations. My only disappointment is the small RAM but since I knew the specs before I really shouldn't complain. Screen is nice and bright and right out of the box everything worked. A memory card would have been nice but for the price I can't expect everything.

It is pretty slow and does not respond properly, there's huge delay. The worst part is it has 1GB memory and with most of the Apps does not install on external SD card, you can have 5 Apps at the most. Absolutely can't install any updates. I wish I had spent a bit more an bought a better phone.I gave it 2 starts just because Yes it is a smart phone, can make calls and can eventually do some browsing.

The phone gets five stars -- Amazon's advertising about it gets three, hence, the four star rating.Amazon rates this phone as 4G, although it is 3G.However I have better service than with my previous Samsung Exhibit II, 4G, also purchased from Amazon.This phone has a fast processor and online manual.
Buen tamaño y precio

column1: I took it with me overseas as a gift to a friend and i was disappointed. lost the money and my friend was not ...
column2: The mobile phone worked only for 2 weeks, I took it with me overseas as a gift to a friend and i was disappointed.lost the money and my friend was not happy never recommend to buy it, we took it to a repair shop and the shop told us this phone can't be repaired since it's not a common phone.

I gave this is as a gift to my mother-in-law on her 79th birthday and she absolutely love it. It has a good size, the screen resolution is reasonable with the prize. The performance is acceptable. I loaded it up with T-mobile Prepaid SIM card and ported her google voice. She used it a lot to call overseas.

In the first few days after delivery, I was very happy with this cell phone. After that the phone screen but blanked out and it hasn't worked since then.When I tried to have it repaired the technician suggested that I purchase a Samsung cell phone since it was not worth the repair cost price.Then I attempted to return the item at Amazon for a refund, UPS had restrictions on return of this product since it contained a lithium ion battery and they could not ship it from a Caribbean destination. I am extremely disappointed and now I do not have a smart phone. Amazon please provide feedback

column1: I ordered this phone on 9th July 2014, it ...
column2: I ordered this phone on 9th July 2014, it came on time as expected but it only worked for a few hours then it refused to power on. I thought I was just unlucky and got a lemon so I asked for a replacement. I got the replacement soon after and lo and behold this time it worked for approximately 24 hours. I sent this one back also this time I asked for a refund. Don't by BLU phones. Just a side note. in the first order I also bought a BLU 4.0 phone , that one worked till today 10th August 2014, one day after the warranty expires with Amazon, so I'm stuck with another lemon.

column2: I had a Blu as my last phone and loved it, I'm glad I upgraded to another Blu! It works great, it's large, which is what I wanted, instructions are clear. It comes with the charger and everything you need, including a screen protector and cheap case. I would definitely recommend this.

The last cellphone that I had finally died out, (it was eight years old) and it was definitely time for an upgrade. This cellphone is fantastic! I love the front camera and since I travel a lot it's perfect for catching quality pictures without dragging around a camera as well. The front camera is a little bit on the low side of quality but reading other reviews I expected this. Overall, it is a great product so far and I haven't found any problems with it yet.

As for the seller. Extraordinary, I arrive on time. The dispatcher took him into custody. Within the mailbox. I recognize them 100%. In terms of product. what I needed. ideal. Recommendations to new buyers. Always read the specifications.

column1: ... are looking for one to use for most app like facebook, whatsapp and other apps i would certainly ...
column2: If you are looking for a cell to make and receive calls this one is ok but if u are looking for oneto use for most app like facebook,whatsapp and other appsi wouldcertainlynot recommend this one. last month i bought 2 phones. 1 for me and the other for my husband. My husband only use his for calls only and it work fine whereas i use mine for everything and after day 3 i was having problems it is always freezing i cannot send facebook messages and sometimes it lock off while using. I am very disappointed and would encourage customers to do their research before purchasing this phone. It can be very stressful when using. this is definitely a bad purchase.

I bought this phone for my wife.I have one and think it's an excellent product for the price.I do have three complaints, but would love to hear solutions for two of them.One, the documentation is next to nothing.If you don't know how to set up/operate a smartphone, you will be lost.Two, the phone is extremely hard to set up on my hands free system on my Chevy Equinox.I finally got it to work (you have to swipe the top down and allow the connection after you turn on the phone).However, it is kind of spotty on connecting.I've had to pull over and reset the connection more than once.Third, the speaker phone is terrible.If there is an adjustment to eliminate the background noise that every caller hears, I couldn't find it.However, the overall phone is great.It works well, doesn't come with apps you don't need or want, and holds a charge for days.

column1: For the Price 5-Star I bought One for My Dad and One for My Son... Probably buying more for other family members
column2: Performs as good or better in all categories EXCEPT CAMERA than my personal Samsung Galaxy S2 and has a bigger screen.Dual SIM is a nice feature.Phone is listed as 4G, but display shows 3G... maybe its my cell provider zone.I am sure it is 4G, no discernible connection speed difference vs. my 4G Galaxy S2.Watch out the BLU 5.0(vs. 5.0 II) is in fact only 3G and slower processer, lower resolution.Still a great phone, but for the little extra go for the 5.0 II.You'll regret otherwise. Very happy.Worth having one as a spare.Screen colors are not quite as good as S2.You won't regret buying one of these unless you are one of those people that needs a leading edge product and is willing to pay 4x

Actually I'm very impressed with this phone. Comes beautifully presented and included to bring a liner and a screen saver. I put the chip from an operator and then worked in Venezuela. It's great and is fast. I highly recommend it; and is also very economical.

column1: 0 II Phone is an amazing gadget, It has all the specifications tha a ...
column2: The Blu Studio 5.0 II Phone is an amazing gadget, It has all the specifications tha a Samsung Galaxy S4 has but much cheaper!It doesn't feel clunky or awkward. It is responsive an fast.If you are Venezuelan and you don't know to render you CADIVI quota , this is a strong candidate! you get a great device for much less than half the price of a Samsung Galaxy.

Call quality is great.I don't drop calls nearly as much as the other unlocked phone I own, and I'm using the same service (I swapped the SIM out from the other phone into this one).I also get much stronger WiFi signal in my apartment (the other phone loses my router if I leave the room), and HSPA+ internet almost everywhere I go, whereas the other phone gets spotty internet service everywhere I go.The included silicone case is a great bonus as well.In all, I'm very happy with this phone and won't hesitate to buy a BLU phone in the future.

The phone met expectations however after receiving it around end of June 2014, in September 2014 it stopped working, does not charge or boot up. Upon attempting to boot up, the following appears on the screen "Blu Products" and this keeps coming up intermittently. Would really like to get this sorted out. I have emailed the address listed on the website and is currently awaiting a reply.

UPDATE: JUNE 20, 2014,I've had this phone for now 3 weeks. Everything seems to work fine. Outside of the occasional app downloaded from the Google Play Store constantly stalling out - the phone was decent as a smartphone and for the price.However, just today while using the phone with a fully charged battery and after talking on the phone - the phone completely died. No battery power, no charge - nothing. Of course there are no links on how to overcome this issue and 3 weeks after purchasing this $119 piece of junk I should haven't to turn around and spend $30 + on a new battery. So do you research, consider that most if not all of these reviews are accurate. I'll be returning this crap for a full refund. I'd rather pay to have my iPhone fixed over buying another one of these cheap phones.Thanks. Never again...******************************I recently purchased this phone and received on Friday 6/6/14. I was surprised at how large it was (length & width), but after working with the phone over the weekend I've gotten used to it especially coming from an iPhone 5 which was longer but not as wide.Pros: Everything works well. I'm using a 64gb SD card, Straight Talk 4G Sim and so far no issues. Cameras decent. Speed is pretty good.Cons: The software installed is not the most current available but phone is capable to get updates I suppose once manufacture releases them (dum). Also, on occasion some apps have crashed while in use or while others are in use (problem but not major).Overall for the price and if you dont want a new cell contract this is a good buy for your buck. It was brand new not used or refurbished. Came with battery, screen protector and cover. The only other draw back is because this phone is soooooooooooo large its hard to find a case but Amazon does appear to sell them but hard to find any locally.So give it a try, all this is just my opinion based on my use - you may feel differently and thats okay. Thanks.

column1: It's great for the price, but not perfect
column2: As an update: I've revised my review to 3/5 stars as Blu and others have released significantly better devices at this pricepoint. For example, there is the Studio Mini LTE which offers double the ram (fixing one of this phones weakest points) at the same price point albeit with a smaller screen.---Original review:This device is a bit of a mixed bag in terms of specs - there are some great things about it but there are also some drawbacks. Should you buy it? My initial testing suggests that the phone may fit a need: if you smash your top of the line device and need something to fill in for the last three months of your contract, if you do not have the funds to spend on something high end, or you need a semi-disposable international phone, this device can definitely fit the bill. Please read my review to decide if the positives outweigh the drawbacks.Build Quality: 6/10 - it is very plastic feeling, but everything fits together nice. It doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart, but the design doesn't stand out in any way either. I don't think this phone would survive drops but it does come with a little silicone cover and screen protector.Screen: 7/10 - The IPS screen is sharp with vivid colors. There is some backlight leak on the bottom corners that is visible on dark screens but it's not a deal breaker. The automatic screen brightness is too sensitive - best left off. The low resolution would be hard to notice unless you've had an HD device before.Processor: 6/10 - the processor is fast enough for every day tasks. It renders web pages quickly and only bogs down when too many apps are running at once - this is definitely not a phone for gamers.Storage/Ram: 4/10 - 512mb ram suffices (just barely). 1gb storage is available to the user. It has MicroSD though. Get one - if you plan on adding any media to the phone you'll need it.Call Audio: 7/10 - Call quality is adequate. Not excellent, but often very good. Callers are loud and clear, but they report calls sound muffled.Media Audio: 7/10 - The audio through the headphone jack is very good to my ears. The headset included is above average. The phone's speaker is average.Signal: 10/10 - Wifi, bluetooth, GPS and phone signal are flawless.Camera: 5/10 - Images from the main camera are smudgy and lack detail, however colour and dynamic range is good. I've used worse though. The front camera is just plain awful - probably the worst part of the phone.OS: 9/10 - Blu didn't screw anything up with the OS. It's basically stock Android with a few useful tweaks. It is very stable, especially considering the limited ram.Battery: 10/10 - Probably the best feature. With 1 SIM and moderate to heavy use I only go through about 50 - 60% of the battery in a day.Total: 71/100This phone has all the basic necessities a smart phone needs without all the silly extras: a decent screen, excellent battery life, and a stable OS. If it is worth the compromises or you cannot afford more, this is the phone for you. It will serve you well. Overall I'm very happy with this device and it does everything my previous phone did. It has left me wondering: why did I spend a ton of money on a flagship phone from another brand when this accomplishes the same things for about 1/5 the price?

column1: BLU Studio 5.0 II Unlocked Dual SIM Phone
column2: The Studio 5.0 II is a fairly nice way to do inexpensive, yet big.The manual is sketchy on a few things, like sim card, micro-sd card placement, which can make for a bit of headache for the non-techie types.The stock Launcher has that search bar on the top of all screens, and wont let you position some things the way you might like, but, by getting Nova Launcher, or another off the googlePlaysite, all these flaws go away.Sound on calls is clear and not tinny to the other party, although the earpiece could be better, it is usable. The micro-sd slot is under the back cover, which is a pain, in my opinion.The ips screen is great on color, and evenly lit.The 512mb of working ram may be small to some, so consider your needs carefully.It may not be a perfect fit for some, but its quite usable if you want a low cost android phone.The 5mp camera takes VERY nice pictures, although the front facing camera is weak, and mine needs serious color correction. In My Opinion... Tech support is not effective to call, but do respond to emails within a 24-48hr window, so dont expect fast answers if you have a question, but they WILL answer.This sucker IS huge, making cases that fit a rare find in local stores, compare to a Galaxy Note 3, or LG G flex, so best you can hope for is generic cases or holsters, as the buttons and charge portdont line up with the other phones.Hmmm, maybe check some of the great buys on Amazon? :-)After buying this phone sight unseen, I would have no problem buying one of BLU'smore expensive models based on what I have seen and handled, but think this will last me a while if handled carefully.

I just got this phone 2 days ago and love it, The only problem I have with it is front camera has poor quality, and the phone is a little big but it dont bother me too much. I would recomend this phone. For the price this phone is awesome.

Sucks, just a big phone for nothing. It say 4g on the box it comes in. But it only have 3g network. It's ok for the price. But not for it to be used on a serious level. This phone is a dead end for me.

column1: WARNING: DO NOT BUY THESE PHONES!!!
column2: WARNING: DO NOT BUY THESE PHONES!!!This is the second BLU phone that I have owned. The charge-port on the first one stopped working. I have had this one for only 6 weeks (BLU Studio 5.0 II) and it has completely died on me. It will not power on anymore.I am totally disgusted with this company. They need to get out of the smartphone manufacturing business if they can make quality products!!!!Update: I contacted BLU about a replacement. They sent me an RMA, however, they want me to pay to have the damaged product shiped back to them. So not only does this company sell defective products, they also no nothing about customer service.

I love the 5" screen.Processor is fast.I have had it about a week with no problems.Buy a sim card when you order this phone it doesn't come with one.( I think Amazon has them for .99 as an add on.They are $15 in local stores.)Update,After 6 months, Phone just turned off and wouldn't charge. nothing....

I love this phone. I've never owned an unlocked phone before. I bought it because I wanted a prepaid phone to use for my business phone. I have it turned on with Straight Talk's service and it works great! I would definitely recommend this phone to anyone. I knew before purchasing that the front camera was low grade and the rear camera was 5.0 MP because I read the specs on the BLU Products website before purchasing, so nothing about the specs bothered me. There were no surprises because I knew what I was buying. If you want a great phone with a great camera I would recommend one of the other BLU Products phones with a higher grade front camera. The features on this phone are amazing.The biggest thing on the list of amazing features is the conference call feature. You can initiate a conference call and disconnect one line without disconnecting all of the callers and having to call back. Another feature I loved was the call waiting. When switching calls, it does not prevent you from initiating a conference call after one caller disconnects. I run into this issue with my personal cell on the Verizon Wireless network.(upadated) I did have one issue with this phone. I could not figure out how to get the SD card in the slot, but someone commented on my review and told me how to. View the comment if you cannot figure it out. Another minor issue is with the text messaging. At times there is a slight glitch that will select a emoticon/emoji in the middle of your typing. It doesn't happen all of the time, but it does happen.This phone is the perfect work phone. I get all SMS, MMS, and e-mail messages seamlessly and there are no issues with the phone thus far. I have had the phone connected for 8 days now and I love it. I'm seriously considering leaving Verizon Wireless because this is a GSM phone and does not work on CDMA (Verizon Wireless, Sprint, Boost Mobile) networks.

nice phone except it is not 4G, false advertised...I even emailed them asking if it was 4G to assure my decision on buying one, they told me yes it is, so don't be fooled it is not 4G...so giving the phone 1 star for B.S. lie

Im a 23 year old student,I have had an iphone for the longest time, and just switched over to andriod and this phone is amazing. I have used the every iphone up to the 5c, and this phoneis up in the runnings with them. Big screen, fast processor, not a lot of bloatware that you get with the galaxies. It is all around a simple great phone.The video quality is good, not perfect but it is better than i expected. it is almost HD, but not quite. It plays netflix very well.The speaker is good, the head phone jack is ok.Call quality is ok i need a little more time with it.Camera is good for what i need it for. 5.0 is not tooo bad. Front camra is similar to the iphone 4 in quality or the ipad 2.The touch screen is ok, im still getting used to the texting on the phone.overall it is a great phone for the money and feel good having it.oh also i have straight talk and i use a micro-sim. but to use a micro sim you have to position it just right for it to read your sim card bc it will be too small so make note of that. (i used my iphone 4s sim) or do as another guy mentioned on here and by another sim.anyway I love the phone and the Size wish i could try more of this brands phone and do more reviews. may add a review on youtube bc this phone is that good.Who should buy this phone?people who dont want to be in a contract but also dont want to pay over $500 for a large screen phone to do basic web browsing, emailing, texting, neflixing, and some gaming( havnt play many games yet on the phone, but it did have some lag while playing splashy fish).This is just my oppinion, i have never owned a galaxy s anything so i am just comparing it to the iphones.I hope this helps you choose the right phone for you. it was either this or the $300 pure life by blu. that will be my next phone!!!!

Ok, I am just going to rate this for what it is...an inexpensive version of a Samsung Galaxy S4. I am a major Apple fan, and have transitioned all of my PCs, tablets, and phones over to the dark side...however, as a previous Android user, I like the flexibility that they offer.Since my dad needed a phone, I heard about the BLU Studio phone, and for the price of a new phone on a 2 year contract, I got this beauty for him, and boy, am I impressed!The phone setup was the easiest transition I've ever done, and I've had all carriers. The phone has 2 sim cards, which I don't need but find very cool.Straight off the box there is a set of headphones, charger, cover, and screen protector...the only thing missing was a SD card, and those are so cheap now, you could have a 64GB for $30.I've downloaded a ton of apps already, and my dad seems like a kid with a new toy. The only problem is both him and my teenager won't stop texting at the dinner table, but that's not the phone's fault! :)
It loads to slow n im havin trouble sending pics I guess the storage space is small I dont like this phone

This phone was bought as a replacement for my grandmother's iPhone that quit working.I decided on this phone based on the current plethora of good reviews and was pretty excited to find that this appeared to be a really good deal.After I got the phone and opened it up, it looked good and felt solid. In my non-expert opinion, this phone looked comparable to my trusty Galaxy S3.I turned it on to begin setting it up for her and it powered right up.Success!I made a good decision in getting this phone!The phone was responsive, the screen looked good, no hangs or odd behaviors.Then about 5 minutes into setting it up, something happened.The screen flickered and it was like the veil was lifted off the cheap build quality of this phone.When the screen came back on, I noticed some vertical lines in the screen, it was like the backlighting wasn't consistent.The pixels weren't dead, they were just dimmer in strips running up the length of the screen.In all four corners of the screen there is, what appears to be, water droplets.They're more dense in the corners and the fade along the edge as you get further away.On the left side of the screen it looks deformed as if it's compressed.The screen itself under the plastic overlay (no, I don't mean the screen protector, which I haven't attached yet) is a milky/hazy color.Then, in the center of the screen, when it is off, you can see the layers of film sticking together.It looks like when you put a screen protector on and it looks a little wet, but it's underneath the outer layer of plastic but above the LCD.Also if you look under the cutout for the menu/home/back keys you can see, what appears to be, moisture build up.Despite the physical issues with the phone, I managed to limp through setting it up.It recognized the SIM, had a good signal.I tried to call out and... nothing.I tried to call the phone and it rang in my ear twice and went to voice mail.Nothing ever showed up on this phone.So I thought perhaps the SIM wasn't seated well.I turned the phone off, removed and replaced the SIM card and powered the phone back up.I noticed that it was taking a while for it to come on, the BLU logo and loading icon came up, then it vibrated for a half-second and the screen went out.The screen came back on and the whole thing happened over again and again and again...It appeared to be stuck in a boot-loop.I popped the battery out and started over.Another boot-loop.Removed and replaced the SIM and battery again.Another boot-loop.I thought the phone was bricked.After 30 minutes of fiddling around with it, it finally came on and stayed on.I'm loathe to restart it or shut it off in fear of it never coming back on again.At the moment, it appears to receive calls and text messages.My grandmother is elderly and lives in out in the countryside.If there were an emergency, this untrustworthy phone is her link to the outside world.I don't trust it, and I hope this is a fluke.I am trying to return the phone, but no avail.I would be happy to discuss this with BLU if they wanted to contact me, but as of right now, this phone is junk and I will not be recommending this brand to anyone.

column1: Worked OK for a while but now its unusable
column2: I've had this for less than a day now, but here are my first impressions.We generally like it very much (I bought this for my wife).I had a few issues (mostly minor):1) the screen brightness outdoors isn't very good (at least compared to my Blu Studio 6 HD)2) I had a hard time getting a micro SD card inserted. I eventually was able to push it into place by inserting the battery behind it3) Installing widgets isn't easy. On my Blu Studio 6, I just press anywhere on the home screen and select widgets and go from there. That follows the online documentation that I've seen. On this phone I was originally able use "google settings" but that no longer takes me to an option to install widgets.4) there is no "settings" icon on the home screen, you have to hit the settings button on the bottom row (settings, home, and back). It took a while to figure this out.5) I haven't got the data connection to work with the H2O wireless Sim but that's probably just the case of changing the settings after I talk to customer supportCertainly so far my wife likes it (its her first smart phone) and its a good buy at the price.After several years of use, all of a sudden this phone starting getting the error "Unfortunately, Settings has stopped." when going to the settings menu. I followed Blu technical supports suggestion of doing a factor reset and now all I see is the above message and the phone is unusable.

First, let me say, I didn't buy my phone on Amazon. I am on here buying one for my mother.I wanted to buy her one like mine because I have decided to move to Vietnam and wanted to be able to trouble shoot for her via Skype.I was almost surprised at all the 1 star reviews. Almost. I have been shopping on Amazon long enough to know that some people will complain if the seller delivered to their door with an IT crew in tow, set up the phone just the way they want it, ask if everything IS just the way they want it, cook them dinner, cleaned the kitchen, tucked them into bed, vacuumed and locked the door behind them after setting the coffee pot for in the morning and still give a 1 star because the lightbulb they changed was a 60 watt bulb instead of a 100. That is just the way some people are.Those are the kind of people that need to shop locally so when they returned something because it was raining to hard two days ago I can see the look on their face when the owner gives them a refund and tells them to never come back because the $2.00 profit they made on the item is NOT worth dealing with idiots like them.That being said. I like my phone. I haven't had a single issue. It looks good. It has a good weight. It is fast. It is a phone. I got what I paid for. I could have bought a more expensive phone but what is the point of having a phone worth more than my car, if someone can pick it up and walk away with it?I don't need a phone that can control the International Space Station. I need a phone.That is what I received. A phone. A $100 phone. I can check my email. Surf the net. Shop. And make phone calls. If you are looking for that, I suggest this phone.If you are looking for a phone to buy so you can complain because the mailman came at 10:03 instead of 10:05...go to EBay.For the people that are going to jump on this review...I am not the seller. I don't know the seller. My review wasn't purchased on the net. I am just someone that bought a phone.

column1: Beware...my BLU Studio II  died in two weeks
column2: First warning was I paid for two day shipping and it took five days to receive the phone.It was a nice phone for two weeks.It was my first Android phone and was finally starting to understand how it worked.Really like the way Jelly Bean reacts.Was never able to connect to 4G.3G worked but was very slow at times.After two weeks of use, I unplugged it from the charger one morning and it was off.The power button would not work. I could not turn on the phone.Removed battery..nothing.Drained battery/recharged...nothing.It was dead.Should note it was never dropped or wet.Did not have a scratch on it.- Tried to contact BLU.It took them a week to get back with me and they told me to go into the setup menu.So I contacted them AGAIN and told them to please read the first email.How can I get to the menu if the power button is unresponsive? They replied the next day with the same suggestion.A week after i had contacted them they sent me an RMA number without offering to pay postage. So BLU customer service is awful.- I was able to return the phone through Amazon for a "full refund".They paid for the shippingbut was charged a $24 restocking fee.Not real happy with BLU or Amazon on this purchase.Beware.Check out the reviews on the BLU Studio 5.0 C HD. For a few dollars more it seems to be a more stable phone.

column1: I would recommend spending a little more for better Customer Service.
column2: I originally LOVED this phone, and the phone itself I still like well enough but god forbid it breaking cause their customer service is below sub-par. I had to send the phone in for repair and just for them to get me the RMA so I could send it back took a week then I had to PAY to ship it to them and wait nearly 3 weeks to get it back. Beyond that I had to keep emailing them because they never gave me any information and then they told me they where shipping the phone soon and would send tracking information I emailed them at the end of that week and did not get a response for ANOTHER week after which time I had already received the replacement phone. While I still like their product I'm never buying from them again because I'd hate to deal with their customer service ever again and paying for a month of phone service that I COULD not use irritated me beyond this. Also when I complained about their poor customer service they didn't even bother to respond to that email and have not even said anything that makes me think they remotely care about their 'valued' customers.

Worked 6 weeks....screen got all pilxilated and froze. This happened 2-4 times in succession and I had to pull battery each time to turn it back on, but by then it was totally dead.The worst of it was, I called BLU customer support 2 times and sat on hold 20 min, and then 30 min. I called BLUs Coorprate number and was told by some snotty chick, "I'm sorry but you need to sit on hold like everyone else" and was immediately transfered to the Customer Support line where I waited 10 min and then hung up.I then called my credit card company and started a dispute. They sent me a denial letter stating, BLU wouldn't release the funds as long as I had posession of the phone.Another call to Credit Card company: "If they never answer their phone, how can I get an RMA number? If I send the phone back without an RMA, they will say it's not an authorized return and I'll have no phone as proof...I'll be out."This lady called BLU TWICE and some girl answered "Hello?". No, "Hello BLU Headquarters" or whatever. This lady was then also put on hold for ten minutes.She came back where I was waiting on hold, explained what had transpired and finished by saying, "This company is horrible, I'm sending your dispute through to get processed!"BLU is one of the worst companies I've ever done business with. I was originally so excited to be working with an American company.....sad to say, they SUCK!

column1: If you want a "smart" phone WITHOUT Bluetooth...this is it.
column2: Why am I rating this phone, which I purchased for myself, one for my friend and, recommended into a purchase for another friend?BECAUSE OF THE BLUETOOTH!!IT ABSOLUTELY DOESN'T WORK ON ALL THREE PHONES!!Now, I'm not one to jump in and rate something as "1-star" out of emotion. These three phones, including my own, were purchased from three different sources (Amazon, MetroPCS and BLU products itself). I would never purchase a smart phone without bluetooth willingly and knowingly.That is what all three phones are.The Bluetooth lights up and turns off within seconds 80% of the time. 20% of the time, it works in an extremely limited range of 3 feet.The signal is INCREDIBLY weak during the 20% of the time the device will pair.In absolute fairness to this phone: The voice quality is great. The speaker is clear and LOUD. The camera is excellent and the video is surprisingly beautiful.However, defective bluetooth and the Google Maps recent update, which I have uninstalled and reinstalled twice, just blows this phone UP!I am a network engineer with 15 years professional experience. I know "a little" about technology, just not enough to make a defective phone work which is broken out of the box. Three of them.

column1: Great unlocked value for the price
column2: Great unlocked value for the price. You can look the phone up on various sites for specs. overall gets the job done. no fancy bells and whistles like other phones. My only gripe is as the end recipient receiving a call from the Blu phone, the mic has poor pick up or sensitivty rating. This leads to sounding as the user is talking into a can. But hey, why should i care? Could use a gig of ram instead of 512mb... this will keep you on your toes with programs that like to always be on when you dont want them to be.......FB!Really like the big display as we deny buying glasses. The size is i think just right. I like the FM tuner as well as it doesn't eat bandwith.NO 5 stars for some techy stuffs but still a good phone.

Purchased this Dec. 2013 on walmarts website. and after 2 weeks I noticed the charger port has issues. Now its even worse and I have to wiggle the wire and bend it to keep it charging. I bought another charger from a store and it won't charge. This Blu company has no real customer service and wish I never got this phone! Update:The Sim card reader stopped working. BLU products examined my cellphone and refused to replace it because they stated it was due to customer negligence. Besides the scratch on the screen the second week of owning it, it was only 8 month I had a case and screen protector. The sim reader failure and charger port problems had nothing to do with negligence! I just purchased a Motorola phone and love it. From now on I will stick with legit brands that I know. Also, this site needs to put reviews in date order because high ratings are put first! I noticed low ratings for this product are not seen first when they are most recent.ZERO STARS...

column1: Great phone for the cheap price. not bad for a replacement.
column2: I've had this phone for two days, and i love it. I really do. bright screen, very fast processor, the sd card slot is very good because the internal memory off the bat sucks,I'm not so used to having the power buttons on the side of the phone so it's taking a bit of time to get used to it. The camera is good for 5 megapixels, It's not a bad phone if you need a replacement and if you have At&t or Tmobile, rodgers, etc. I do not know if the phone is compatible with Metro PCS gsm cards yet.The battery lasts for a while without charging and it charges very fast unlike my old HTC ONE. even turned on.Overall I'm happy with my phone but I am looking to upgrade later to the life pure or the life pure XL, but overall if your on tmobile or At&t and cant afford one of their overpriced phones this is not a bad replacement...

I bought this phone in the store which was more expensive. I am overall satisfied with the phone. Both SIM cards did work the phone makes phone calls internet works. the negative which is kind of important to me is that the front camera is really bad it looks like you're in a time warp and navigation just forget about it its totally out of whack.and if you're playing music the phone glitches a lot. The other thing is is there's not very much memory on the phone. But overall it's okay you get what you pay for I understand that. Also no one can ever hear what I am saying they say that it is muffled

Physical characteristics - the phone seemed to be solidly constructed, if a bit chunky. Unassuming, inoffensive, but not entirely unattractive. A bit like most mid-size sedans in that respect. I was initially worried about the size of this phone, having come from a cheap 4" pre-paid device. It didn't turn out to be nearly as difficult to handle as I'd expected, and as some keyboard apps let you easily have a different-sized on-screen keyboard snapped to the left or right, even one-handed texting didn't pose a problem. The included silicon case did the job, though it really is a shame there doesn't seem to be many others making cases for Blu devices. Couldn't get the included screen protector on right, but was able to order more from another vendor on Amazon. If you want a leather case for it, just search for cases made for a bare M8 or S5 - they wind up being about the right size.Screen - the screen, too, was much better than expected. Viewing angles were good, colors looked right, and it was simply pleasant to look at. Much better than I'd been expecting, given the relatively low resolution. The text and icons appeared quite sharp enough for me, though nobody will mistake it for a higher-end device based on the screen. The only downside of the low-res screen is that text and interface elements tend to scale for the screen size 800x480 usually gets you. This meant that whether I was reading or texting (what I use my phone for most), I didn't really get to have more text on the screen than I did with my old 4" phone, which had the same screen resolution. This could, however, be a plus if your vision is poor.Speed - this phone's processor will break no records, but it's more than adequate for most uses. Photo editing, light gaming, reading - none gave me any trouble. The only trouble was...Memory - with only 512mb RAM, this phone isn't great for multitasking. It's not uncommon to be switching apps and have to wait for it to load. Normally, this is no more than an annoyance. Just 5-10 seconds that didn't need to be spent waiting. But having to wait for Hangouts to load nearly every time you want to send a text can get bothersome. Still a minor complaint, just something to be aware of. Storage is a bigger issue. You have 4gb total...but the way it's allocated, with a substantial portion of available space as a "virtual SD card" of sorts, leaves you just under 1gb for app installation. That's not a typo...one gigabyte. I was still able to install most of the apps I would normally have installed, and certainly all the ones I cared about; I just had to transfer every single one to the SD card I put in. I wound up with about 500mb still available.Camera - it was better than I'd expected - the colors seemed good, and low-light wasn't completely terrible. And the dual-LED flash was really not bad at all, and seemed to cast a neutral tone instead of the yellow tinge that seems to plague cheap phones. None of my photos were especially clear, though - a picture of the lawn in the middle of the day left the fence and grass blurry. So it's not a replacement for a decent point-and-shoot camera, but it'll do fine for basic snapshots. That said, the much cheaper Lumia 520 I have performed much better taking the same shots at the same time.Battery life - it got me through a day of light/medium use with no trouble, though that bright screen can seriously eat into your battery if you leave it on too long.Mine did wind up having an issue, unfortunately: the brightness controls. If set to automatic, the screen would switch between high and low brightness about once a second or so. And if I tried to set the brightness manually, after ten or so seconds it would simply jack itself up to maximum brightness (which is extremely bright on this phone).A combination of that and the annoying and unnecessarily restrictive storage partitioning are what brought my score down to three stars. It would otherwise have been four.

I have had this phone for over a year now.I couldn't be happier with it. I'm glad I waited a year to write a review and pleased to say that it has passed the test of time.I use it with Straighttalk and I'm continuously impressed with the quality of the calls and the flawless app performance.For most of the first year I only had one sim card installed but I recently purchased a card to use in Europe later this year.Through "settings" I was able to turn off the new card until we getto Europe.I do recommend this phone.

column1: ... phone for about 2 weeks and so far so good! Had an S3 before this so I wanted ...
column2: I've had my phone for about 2 weeks and so far so good! Had an S3 before this so I wanted an unlocked phone that was better or at least comparable without spending a fortune. So far it has met my expectations.PROS: Fast processor. Very similar to S3 set up, large screen, FM radio,basically all features you would find on S3. Dual sims if needed. Upgrade to 4.4kitkat.CONS: camera not so good.Even though it has Bluetooth that works great with streaming apps and wireless headphone, the FM radio won't work with the Bluetoothit give a message saying must plug in headphone to use as intena.Overall very good phone for someone on a budget

I ordered this phone on Sunday and received it Thursday, so the shipping was reasonable and fast:)My Package included:The UNLOCK Phone itself ( mine was white)White EarphonesSleekwhite ChargerInstruction manualRubber Clear CaseSIM Card: It will recognize the SIM card immediately so it was easy to set up. I use H20 wireless.Design and Screen: Very thin and fits comfortable in the hand. It feels light and the screen is the perfect size. Its not too small and not too big. The screen is 5 inches.Battery Life: Its battery life is average and acceptable. I can moderately text, call, game, listen to music, etc. throughout the day without charging it.Screen and Resolution: EXCELLENT! It's beautiful and clear. The colors are very vivid and the graphics are detailed.Speed: This phone isn't the fastest phone on the planet. Its noticeably slower and more laggy than the Iphone 5 or the Samsung. Although the speed is acceptable to me, so do except some lag when playing games or sudden crashes to heavy apps.Camera: This is probably one of the most complained faults about this phone. The back camera takes decent pictures, but the front isn't very good. So I don't recommend using this phone for video chat. If you are the type of person who takes a lot of "selfies", I do advise for you to look for a more expensive phone. Memory: This phone has 512 MG RAM, which isn't a whole lot to most people's desire. For me it was ok since I don't download a lot of apps, but do be aware when you are downloading a lot of apps of how much this phone can store.Overall, this phone is extremely good with the price. I would definitely buy this phone for someone just looking for the basics in a smartphone. For the price, it exceeds all expectations and proves itself to be a worthy phone to look into.

column1: would be a great phone if the speaker didn't sound blown out
column2: Cheap phone, would be a great phone if the speaker didn't sound blown out, the camera focused better, AND THE MEMORY DIDNT SUCK ASS. I have a SD card & can't get over 12 apps and like 30 photos. Deleted my music for one more app. That's s***. Because the phone itself really doesn't let you save everything to an SD card. So its just cheap s***. Go to eBay. Order a refurbished Samsung galaxy from China for the same price & you'll be happier.

This is a good phone for making calls. As an android device however it lacks memory. Since apps have to load onto the phone memory and then be moved to the external SD card there is problems. Part of the phone RAM is needed even if the app s moved to the SD card. If you only need a fewapps go ahead. If you are trying to use it instead of your tablet get one with at least 8 GB before you add the SD card.

column1: The problem got worse and to a point where I couldn't text properly
column2: Speed of the phone is very very slow, so much so that the app hangs if you try to refresh the page your on just because you've been waiting for so long. I've had a Samsung Galaxy S3 and S4 and even then the phone speed was much faster than this. However, this was bearable given the price of the handset and I was will to compromise and be patient. However, less than 2 months of normal gentle use, the screen started to distort and shake. I shut off my phone thinking it was an interference or something and turned it back on. Same thing. The problem got worse and to a point where I couldn't text properly. Of course at this stage, the phone is still somewhat usable though since I can hardly open the right app at any one time its totally unbearable. I feel dizzy just looking at it.Surely and not even slowly, this phone will disappoint. I'm not even sure its worth me sending it back for warranty :(.

I was in need of something quick so I guess I cant really complain. The size is nice, not to big and not to small. Easy to access apps as well. Better than paying hundreds of dollars for a phone I'd break. My only complaints are the memory and quality of the camera. For a person that loves pictures and apps, this isn't for you. If you just need a nice phone..Go BLU..

They do NOT last long. I have owned the Pure Life One, and the Studio 5.0. Both were glitchy. The Studio 5.0 seemed perfect, for the first two weeks. I lost GPS hardware first, then a week later, data stopped working. The company doesn't stand behind their product. I wouldn't recommend this brand.

Nice phone nice price. I am not into the hype of camping outside a store for days to buy a phone. I am the master of my life not a phone. My phone serves me I do not serve it. Been using this for a little while and it is decent, a good display, function well and most of all it meets my needs.

This phone appears to be a awesome phone. It definitely is not. It is the worst decision I have ever made as far as phone shopping. Blu's customer service is even worse than the product. I do want to say that I did not buy my phone from Amazon. There is a part in the phone called the proximity sensor. This is supposed to turn the screen off when the phone is near your face. If it doesn't work you will hit random buttons on the pone with your face. This is o of many things that sucked on this phone.Icon would move on their own from screen to screen. The camera is really bad. The picture quality was horrible and all the pictures came out blue. I reached out to customer service and through email for almost 7 weeks they just kept leading me no where. All I wanted was a new phone and this was with in one week of purchase. Anyway This problem never got resolved and I went and bought a used Samsung S3 for the same price. WAY BETTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Please don't fall for this. You really get what you pay for in this situation.

column1: works great but call in about the internet settings
column2: the phones flow is remarkable got the phone because of the good reviews and they were right. it is worth the money, this same phone retails for over twice as much in stores. make sure to unlock the block on the internet system within mobil network but if your with a phone they will help you.

I am very happy with this purchase. I have had it less than a month but cannot find any quirks in it. I wish there was a choice of covers, but it does come with one so it is not so bad. I would recommend this purchase to anyone who wants a good low cost phone.

column1: I cant say i hate this phone because i couldnt get one that worked
column2: I cant say i hate this phone because i couldnt get one that worked. I ordered the first one two weeks ago and worked with straightalk for hours trying to get it to accept a sim card. Finally called Blu and they said the phone was defective. So i returned it and was sent a second phone. I put the sim card in and for three seconds had service. I again spent several hours on the phone trying to get the phone to work. Called Blu for the second phone and they said the exact same thing. column1: One of the best 'cheap' smartphones out there!
column2: I purchased this phone for a relative on WIND mobile after my positive review of another BLU smartphone purchased off Amazon last year. And let me say, after having two BLU phones in my hand, BLU makes incredible phones at incredible prices! This one is a lot better than the 'basic' smartphone I purchased earlier in that it's extremely fast, there is no lagging, photos are clean & crisp, the screen is vibrant and everything works great (i.e. calling, texting, browser). This is one unlocked smartphone that is totally compatible with WIND, so definitely check it out if you're with them! The only downside some may see with this phone is the storage - you pretty much have to buy an SD card if you're going to be doing a lot, which isn't too bad considering Amazon has some for like less than $10.Overall, 5/5!!!

Just like most people, I didn't want to spend a lot on a new phone seeing as they never seem to last very long. My last didn't make it 2 yrs before the screen blacked out. Did some searching on Amazon and this brand seemed to get some good reviews. Good price for a decent sounding phone. Most importantly, a reviewer mentioned that it works on Rogers network in Canada. I don't need the dual SIM but works fine with one. I don't need too many fancy features so I don't really know how to comment on the features other in laymans terms. Its a decent camera, clear screen. Great to have a screen protector and case included. I find that the screen isn't the most responsive with the protector on. Need to tap a bit harder sometimes. The earbuds are a bit annoying because they make a lot of noise if they get rustled around. Not static but the physical movement. Found that if I'm just listening to music, I drape it behind my neck and that solves it. Overall, good phone, good price, great delivery (estimated one week delivery, came in 2 days).UPDATE: July 30/14One month in and the screen is now flickering, my phone has no service and my service provider can't tell if its the phone or my SIM. Contacted BLU customer service and no response! So far, not happy. Will update more as the drama continues.Sept 6/14Finally sorted out and sent my phone in. They sent back a replacement. I turned it on for one day and it started turning itself on and off and now won't turn on AT ALL. I've asked for a refund. Waiting to hear back.Oct 15/142nd replacement has been working well for a week now. Let's hope this ordeal is over.

was afraid to buy a no name phone on amazon...but after reading many reviews i decided to take a chance.........at first i panicked after buying as i found out it took what they call a mini sim card...but all that means here in canada is a regular size sim....the phone came so fast ..only 2 business days.......took it right to my provider (telus) and for 10 bucks i had a new sim that fit.......it is big, bold, and beautiful..........so many features i could sit here for a month figuring them all out............the ear phones that came with the phone.......are way better than the standard plug things...........all the features seem to work fine.....set up netflix without a hitch....as well as youtube and facebook.......as i know there is limited space on this model i will wait till i pick up a micro sim card to do anything else...........i am so so glad that i bought this baby........bye bye crappy phones with tiny screens only an eagle can see...........

column1: Aside from the obvious - it being a smart phone - I wanted to have a place to ...
column2: I bought this phone with the intention of it being a multi use device. Aside from the obvious - it being a smart phone - I wanted to have a place to store my music, and my ebooks. With a 128g additional storage capacity, I think I've got what I was after with this phone.The phone is big and an upgrade from the S3 mini I had been using. Reading books on this is not as monotonous as I would have thought. The screen size for reading (in my opinion) is just on the ample side and not too small. The phone fits in my cargo pocket at work, without beating my leg up when I walk.I am not the kind of consumer that needs to have the latest and greatest gadget. I can usually make due with something comparable and a couple generations old. I spent a little more on the S5 than I normally would on any phone, but could justify it knowing it would be basically a 3 in 1 device.I read reviews and watched a ton of videos on youtube about this phones capabilities. I won't get into those here because they are stil there (online) and free to all. I may never fully unlock the potential of this phone to warrant putting any of my own videos online, but for my needs - it's good.Some people are hard on their devices and turn around and blame the manufacturers for any 'shortcomings'. One small detail needs to be pointed out: the charging cover on this phone is flimsy and would be REAL easy to get broken off. Two things - 1: WHENEVER you unplug the charger, the phone prompts you to CLOSE THE COVER as a courtesy reminder. 2: A simple conscious effort on the part of the owner can also alleviate this from happening. If you break the cover off - it's most likely all on you.I hope this phone will last me some time and am looking forward to learning more as I go...

The phone came in a sealed box and was definitely completely new. It was unlocked as expected, however branded to Vodacom (only noticable by the flash screen on startup). Not sure what that means for the warranty but I assume Samsung will honor their warranty no matter the original carrier. Since that is the only noticeable thing about it and it works fine with my SIM card, I don't care, but if it bothers someone, you'd have to root it to get rid of it. Another thing is that it came with an European charger and a cheap chinese adapter. I had some other Samsung chargers lying around, and bought it for Europe anyway, so I was happy about that. If you want to use it mainly in the US, you may want to get another Samsung charger.I used the phone in Dalvik for a while and noticed a significant improvement in speed after switching to ART. It turned hot briefly after the switch, but after that it ran smoothly and I had the feeling battery life improved also (although it was already great to begin with, it lasted 2+ days playing music, watching movies, using navigation plus mobile data and WIFI). I was at first worried that some apps would not run, but non of the apps had a problem, in fact, they almost uniformely ran better, except for the Kindle app which is incredibly slow for some reason and was from the beginning (did only try the Samsung version).Amazon music on the other hand runs perfectly.The design of the phone is beautiful, the colors of the screen are great and it is easily readable in bright sunlight. A joy to watch movies. I was also impressed with the sound quality of the included headphones. The camera makes great photos even in low light, and does not have the lag I had on my old phone. The front camera is gritty in low light, but that is to be expected. The fingerprint sensor works amazingly well. I have one on my HP laptop, and did expect the one on the phone would have the same problems with sweaty fingers, but it worked well even when I was biking.That said, it also works great as a phone ;).Overall, I'm very happy with this phone, and also with the seller. Delivery was speedy (arrived three days before the Amazon predicted date).I should mention that I got this phone from Top10Cell, since there are different sellers for this. As I said, Top10Cell was selling the African (Vodacom) model.

Brilliant!Came in the box.Has a nice sticker over the side that states "Do not accept if seal is broken"Inside the box is a shiny new S5 SM-900FD phone with all the plastic still in place.Under that is the SN and ID data sheet / sticker...(don't loose).Under that a quick start guide.Below that you find the Charger (Euro), cables, earbuds and a Euro to US plug adapter for the charger.But since its basically a USB adapter any USB Phone charger 'should' work fine (check the voltages though).Some people seem to have been confused by the Euro charger.Im guessing the term "International" didn't quite hit home for them.The screen is untouched, the back is untouched and apart from the addition of the US adapter its a perfectly fine almost straight from the factory box.Just make sure you check the UPC on the box "Before" you break the seal.My only quibble is the packaging.. No kind of bubble wrap or shock material at all.The package was snug around the box so it didn't "bounce around" in the box.But there was little in the way of shock absorbing materials.UPS delivered the package un molested though.

column1: I thought it didn't work, and was ready to return it, but then....
column2: I just received it today and got the SIM card from the ATT store - I stepped in around closing time, and waited a half hour after for service, so when the guy seemed confused that he couldn't immediately connect to the data network, I told him I'd take it home and fiddle with it. I tried to log into the ATT mobile network several times at home, but it kept rejecting the connection; then I checked the info on the phone and confirmed I had received the correct G900F version of the phone.I then turned to the Amazon reviews, and based on various reviews that claimed their phones did not work, I became depressed that maybe I had just made a terrible mistake and submitted a claim to Amazon for a return (thank god for the reliability of Amazon to take back almost anything... ). But just to make sure, I decided to research a little more about linking unlocked phones to the ATT network, and fortunately, I happened to notice a youtube video that described how to link your unlocked phone to the ATT network (thank you, smart you-tubers, for posting your smarts for free online). After watching a couple of videos to find the version with the most current phone (the S4), I figured out how to configure my phone settings to connect to the 4G LTE network, and I have cancelled my return. Hopefully, this phone will be worth all the initial work and future learning that I will need to do to go from the iphone to this... So far, at least, I like the way the phone looks...

column1: Samsung seal broken and instead a non-original samsung seal over it
column2: The original Samsung seal was broken and SHOPEBEST seller put a non-original Samsung seal instead. I can tell that because the logo was not in same quality as original. I could carefully open that seal (which with original i wouldn't be able to) and found out the Wall chager was an european one, so they had to put a non-Samsung adapter. So i dont know if they broke the Samsung seal because of that or because it wasnt a Factory unlocked pone. They could say that in description or something like that.DONT buy from SHOPEBEST.

Received phone today in sealed box, with no issues. I got the European model, all functionalities look good. Installed all the updates for Kitkat, have downloaded Lollipop, but I will install that later, since I hear of many issues after installing Lollipop in S5. My micro sim has not arrived yet, so waiting for it to check the network coverage. Got an European charger in the box, but they have included an adapter so it works in US too. Surprisingly S5 is compatible with my old Galaxy ace charger, so I am using that instead.Edit: Got my H2O microsim card via Amazon and was easy to transfer my existing phone number to the new sim via their customer support chat. Was able configure mobile network using the settings from their site, and I am getting HSPA+ speeds which is pretty fast. Will have to see how to get 4G LTE speeds later.

i love this phone.... the delivery was on point and it came sealed with usb cable , headphones, and user guide... the phone is wonderful, the screen is so bright and clear... it works well on Digicel network in the caribben (jamaica, Antigua) although it says H+ instead of 4G whereas my Galaxy s3 says 4G so idk whats up for that , but the phone runs fast like 4G speeds and the heart rate monitor works well along with the finger print lock .... i have an issue tho with the smart remote where it always force close when i try to use it to change a channel or turn the volume up on my TV (please help cuz i really like this app) but otherwise from those little glitches i am a happy customer

I particularly wanted this type of phone for texting, and find that with a little help from my granddaughter I've been able to pick up operating this phone with tolerable ease.
