column1: Ordered this item two times from Blutek, two times returned and really disappointed
column2: I used my friend's Amazon prime account and ordered this smartphone twice, considering great reviews by other customers on the sellers and product. But I was just disappointed as the first item came with seal not intact (the seal itself also used double tape, pretty unusual for the Samsung Galaxy as I have been loyal customer to Samsung). The second item I ordered, I couldn't find a way to close the back cover properly, it always opens near the charging hole. If I could give negative review, I would do so. Don't buy!

There are so many mixed reviews on this product, but the reasoning for this is because people are not researching the sellers. Just because it's says it's sold by Samsung does not mean it's sold DIRECTLY from Samsung! There are millions of distributors of Samsung phones, some are even scams. I used cell-sell, and it came in complete retail packaging and the phone had NEVER even been touched! I have also heard that Bluetek USA is very credible, but I could not find this product for sale by them.THIS DOES NOT HAVE 4G, it is H and H+ which I do not mind, it is just as good if not better than 4G, at least through AT&T in my area(Mankato, Minnesota), works perfectly in the USA!UPDATE--09/14/2017--Still holding up amazing! Couldn't recommend a better phone for the price. RESEARCH YOUR SELLERS BEFORE BUYING!! This can't be stressed enough!! I have gotten 4G in some spots in North Dakota oddly enough, but for 95% of the time it is H and H+.

Got this phone to replace my old s5 - I was very happy to see it was brand new in the box and sealed. I have AT&T prepaid so I was a little worried especially after reading some of the reviews that it wouldn't work with my carrier, but it did! I'm in the US, at&t and it works just like the old phone.

column1: ... won't say much about the phone except that I hate the material its made of
column2: I won't say much about the phone except that I hate the material its made of ..."plastic"Plus the way it feels in my hand it seems like I better not drop this phoneThe camera is great battery life is okay the real problem is the software as touch wiz is one of the worst laggiest Roms with tons of unused and misplaced features I have ever usedI mean the phone has SD801 processor and it can't go head to head with my beloved nexus 5 because of their s***** ROMBottom line for 700 bucks you could get a way better device like the LG G3 or wait for S5 Prime

column1: 1 star for 'it did not work for me'. ...
column2: 1 star for 'it did not work for me'.I have ATT service in the US and it would not allow my current S4 sim operate, i.e., no signal.I took it to the ATT store and they tried as well.Apparently since I have a grandfathered in free data plan, ATT will not allow this unit to connect...BTW, the unblocked 900A works flawlessly.900H will only receive a fall-back signal, I forget which one, at 400kbps.Shop Amazon so you can return what does not work.

column1: DON'T BUY THIS AND SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY !!!! IT IS A DEFECTIVE PIECE.
column2: We bought this handset in January as a gift for mom's b'day. She was very happy with the product until it stopped working in June. PS. note that it was handled with great care, there is no damage caused by us. We later found that many people have similar problem and it is problem with software. We contacted Amazon and they asked us to call Samsung and they didn't help stating that its not manufactured in USA and gave us a number to Samsung Korea which we didn't seems to be working.we couldn't get it fixed an finally as a disappointment she has to buy another phone. We are waiting for response from seller as we expect full return for this defective piece.

column1: WARNING: DO NOT BUY FROM BREED
column2: DO NOT, and i repeat DO NOT purchases this product from the seller "BREED". I received my phone and after transferring my pictures from my old phone and downloading apps, the phone was full. So you would often see me deleting an app in order to take a picture #annoying. I requested a return as soon as i realized (because i never had this problem with my s3). My return request was never answered, and while i continued to wait i purchased a memory and the phone would not read the memory card. I tried the same memory card in my sister's phone and it worked. I now realized I have a much bigger problem than i thought. SO i then sent another return request (a few weeks later); this time i got a response saying my 60 day return period had expired. This is true but what pissed me off is the fact that they ignored my initial request in order to allow the 60day period to run out. After going back and forth with them and getting no satisfaction, i took the phone to a repair shop to fix thememory card slot. They refused to fix it because they said the s5 is made in such a way that you cannot open the back without running the risk of damaging some other part of the phone. So i just gave up totally. Besides taking good pictures, the s5 is a waste of time and money BUT just incase you do decide to still get it, DO NOT BUY FROM THE SELLER 'BREED '.

column1: Phone works in the US, India and Russia
column2: Bought this for my mom. Not the easiest of people to please, but she absolutely loved it.Used it first in the US for a week with a US simcard. Then used it in India & Moscow with an indian simcard.It worked as advertised.Pls read the fineprint, where it says certain colors should be unlocked by using in the US before using it elsewhere.The phone comes preset with a non english language, I think it was the thai language, but you should be able to switch it to english.....

column1: Please be aware of the phone's compatibility
column2: It took me a while to figure this out. Those who plan to purchase an unlocked phone and intend to use it inside US please be careful. Most S5 models came with LTE capability, but not all of them are compatible with the US provider. For example: G900A is specific for AT&T, 900T is for T-Mobile etc. Some of them are interchangeable but you need to be aware of the compatibility. For example, 900F model (this one) supports LTE 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100 (these numbers are actually frequency like in the radio channel), but AT&T provide LTE using 700. The reason I rated 4 is because I think they should provide more information like this to the customers.

column1: I have checked in internet forums and that problem seems to occur in many of the Samsung Galaxy S5 phones so i would recommend n
column2: I have about six months using this phone, at the beginning everything worked Ok but a few days later and ramdomly the screen turned yellow-green and after touching firmly the screen returned to its normal color. Since a few weeks ago that problem is happening daily and I have not obtained an explanation for that. I have checked in internet forums and that problem seems to occur in many of the Samsung Galaxy S5 phones so i would recommend not to buy this phone.

column1: I bought two of these phones about 4 weeks apart ...
column2: I bought two of these phones about 4 weeks apart. Neither phone will upgrade via OTA or Kies 3.x. One of them was listed as white on the box and came as black, actually preferred but also had a sim card for the army-navy-coast guard and marines so asked what branch i was in. I think they have all been custom roms installedand the second one will not even connect to Kies. I think I need to spend time to use the ODIN tool and flash the orig version of Kitkat4.4.2 on it then try and upgrade but I am still stateside and there are many countries listed and not sure how many hours i want to invest in doing this only to have a phone with foreign language apps or some weird stuff on it. Really do not want the slower processor "octacore" either so a conundrum for when I head overseas again.

column1: Can't do 4G in the USA, at all, ever
column2: If you are in the US and want 4G in the US, DO NOT BUY a G900F or G900H.If you want 4G in the US, you must buy the G900T for T-mobile, or the G900A for AT&T.I am sure the phone itself is great, but I relied on the seller's description and did not look through the buyers' reviews.Hope this saves some of you the frustration that I have experienced!

column1: A fantastic phone - probably the best value in late 2015.
column2: Awesome phone. I love every aspect of it, from the camera to the processing speed, audio and menu system. I bought this to replace my HTC1 M7, which was great while it lasted but had Bluetooth issues. Bluetooth on this works very very well. My only complaint is that I used the USB cable to charge it and the USB port cover broke off. SO ANNOYING. That's the biggest flaw on this phone.

Until now this mobile is incredible, before I bought the same mobile from another seller and I got a big problem. But now from this seller the mobile I liked it more because I chose white colour. I liked everything. The only thing is the charger that comes for europe and asia input, but also comes with an adaptor of 120voltage. I really liked more that way because I travel to Europe frequently, so for me the charger is ok. The mobile samsumg is awesome, the camera is HD and it is 4G LTE.Regards,

column1: Came sealed, works perfectly in Caribbean/Digicel
column2: Yes, mine seems to have come from Saudi Arabia. Hey, it's the international version. Works perfectly here in Trinidad and Tobago with Digicel.I got a different sim card, as my carrier didn't have the proper blank for cutting...my old sim has a round-edged component that was too close to where they had to cut. Until they get the proper blank, I just got a new number and am keeping my old one for when I don't want to risk taking my nice phone around some places (sadly, critical here.)The only other problem was that the plug for recharging was European standard. Luckily, the plug for my iPad works fine. Just plug the USB end into it.This phone charges really fast, but if you aren't careful, the battery goes down very fast, too. Be smart and use a booster app (APUS is amazing!). Also, the Ultra Power-saving Mode helps a lot. It makes everything go b/w, keeping activeonly apps that you choose. (I keep my messages, clock, and phone active.) Only takes about 30 sec to turn it back to normal, too.

column1: Man! I couldn't realise how great Android can be!
column2: It's as just great as people say...The device comes with every component as if you had bought it in a fisical store...No problems using it in other countries...I advise people to get a case and a screen protector when buying the cell...I had a little problem with Amazon about the delivery... But Amazon's crew were very kind, helped me in every instant and I got my cellphone just perfect...They even got me a refund for the delivery method (that was not honored by the seller - I think) and a voucher because of the late on the delivery process.That's it I think... the product is amazing... I used to have an iPhone 5s, and was getting worried about my adaptation to the new operational system... but man! Android is just awesome! :))That's ir folks... hope helped someone in any way.Peace.

column1: Basically fine, not to excited about it
column2: Basically fine, not to excited about it. I chose the Galaxy S5 over the S5 mini for it's quality but now I regret my decision.My Galaxy S3 is much more comfortable, smaller and easy to hold and operate with one hand.the device is too big for me and the microphone doesn't work at all.

column1: This phone works great, if you live in Europe
column2: Soon after I bought this phone I noticed I wasn't getting 4G LTE as promised all I was getting was H+ or 3G. I did a little digging and found this model was for if you live in Europe and the only way to get it here and have the 4G LTE work in where ever you live:Samsung SM-G900F for EuropeSamsung SM-G900I for AsiaSamsung SM-G900K/G900L/G900S for KoreaSamsung SM-G900M for VodafoneSamsung SM-G900A for AT&TSamsung SM-G900T for T-MobileSamsung SM-G900W8 for Canada

So far, so good. Unlocked phone, holds a charge all day with GPS running, misc texting and gmails, some audiobooks. This is the model that receives 4G. No complaints yet. Will update if any come up. Headed overseas soon so will see how it does with a sim card there.And, no need for a contract with U.S. company - yeah!!

As advertised.I asked a lot of questions, as we live in Mexico and I wanted to make sure.It shakes hands with Telcel and Movistar seamlessly.The charger came with a two prong thingy for international voltage, but also an adaptor so no biggie.I recommend this seller.

When I first plug it into the charger, it said the battery is 65% already (so the battery is not fully empty?!). I got the product for Romanian market...so none of the manuals is printed in English, but I think I can always google when I need to know something about the phone. But as other reviews say, it may not have warranty in US. I had the phone for about a week and so far it works well. Love it!I think I need to edit my review...coz last nite the camera didn't work, and I remember it happens once or twice before. The screen went into black and after few seconds it says 'Camera failed'. I restarted it and it went back to normal. But still love the phone!

column1: Great on the inside, cheap on the outside.
column2: The software part is great. Only issue with it is the fact that they removed the thermometer, apparently due to an issue with the underwater feature. I don't plan on swimming with my cellphone anytime soon, and the thermometer feature was very useful as it let you know the actual temperature of the occupied space, as opposed to the general city temperature, but it might be a minor or irrelevant thing to another user.The physical phone itself is another thing. The glass is very resistant to scratches and the display is great, but everything else is very cheap. The side of the phone has eventually peeled off in patches everywhere near the front facing side, and gives it a very worn, ugly look. The back cover looks good but is very weak. I dropped it once or twice on a carpet and the left edge broke off, and one of the locking parts as well, so it never locks tightly. Also, the "samsung" letters just fell off on their own. There's only the spaces left. I'm sure if they put in just a minor upgrade into the quality of the materials the phone would look much better, but right now it has a quite cheap, worn feel to it. Curiously, my Samsung S3 mini and S4 never suffered from this wearing down, and I take great care of all of my phones.

column1: Love the phone and all the "goodies" but the sound ...

column1: No 4G LTE in the US. Only H+ ..... Aside from that, great phone.

It's amazing ♥ ♥ ♥ I'm so happy I got it, the screen is beautiful, the pictures are beautiful, the UI is superb, it's just an overall amazing phone (Upgraded from the S4). My one problem is that the description advertises 4G LTE capabilities and that's just not true.I bought this phone and plugged in my T-Mobile SIM card. I pay for unlimited 4G LTE coverage, but I can't use it because this phone does not have 4G LTE in the US. So, I'm not happy about that. The highest this will go in the US isH+ . I don't even know what H+ is... so, that's useless, in my eyes.I wish the listing was honest about it. Other than that the phone itself is amazing, the description is just highly misleading. So, if you're hoping for 4G LTE and you're in the US, don't buy this.

It has english and arabic user guide inserts and you'd have to use the adapter provided with the product to be able to charge the mobile. The phone does not work on T-mobile 4G, but will work in many other countries. For folks buying to use the mobile in India, it won't work on 4G LTE because India uses 2300 TDD band which this phone does not support.The features like heart rate monitor takes a while getting used to and forces you to sign up with samsung. The finger scan is a pain if you are using the otterbox defender series protective case!

The item delivered was European model and clearly says on seal to use with a European SIM and to be in Europe when using it first time ! This should have been informed in the product description when selling in USA.Returning it without opening the box.

When it arrived the package had been open and an off-brand USA compatible adapter was placed instead of what I assume would have been a Korean wall adapter. Whatever, it worked so I didn't care.About 6 months later, the home button started to fail. It then completely failed (literally can not use the home button, very frustrating) plus the microphone failed. NO ONE can hear me unless I am on speakerphone! Worthless! Samsung USA was no help because its from Korea and now I am stuck having wasted $500 on a phone that I literally can not use. This phone isn't even a year old. I will never buy Samsung again.
